The Data Scientists turns data into actionable insights using tools and models from statistics, AI and Machine Learning to enable better decision making. They collaborate with stakeholders to translate a business problem to a mathematical problem that can be solved using data and analytics. They gather, analyse, combine and aggregate the data sources required to solve the problem, then develop the appropriate solution and communicate its possibilities and limitations. They are responsible for the quality of the solution, for example prediction accuracy. Understands the different aspects of the end-to-end model life cycle (problem formulation, exploration, development, testing, deployement and monitoring). Has a solid data science skillset and the experience needed to drive the implementation of a solution at any stage of the product life cycle.

Audit Transformation – Data Science – Manager/Sr. Manager
Deloitte’s Audit and Assurance business embraces the promise of artificial intelligence and machine learning, with various forms of AI and ML embedded in the audit technology solutions currently used by our 10,000+ practitioners today. Within our dedicated Data Science organization, a subgroup of the Audit Transformation group, we continue that journey enabling the next generation of AI-enabled solutions that usher in a future that completely transforms the way our practitioners perform their audit work, and the insights we can provide to our clients.
The Data Science group consists of a blend of auditors and data scientists working hand-in-hand to capitalize on our world-class data assets and ideate, design, develop, deploy, and manage AI and ML solutions that can be integrated into our existing Omnia ecosystem to increase the quality of our audits, and automate mechanical processes. You will be joining a growing team of talented professionals dedicated to realizing the vision of an AI-enabled audit.
As a Manager or Senior Manager in the Data Science group, you will serve as a subject matter expert, leading the auditing and process-specific components of our Data Science workstreams and AI and ML solutions.
Specifically, you will be expected to:
Define the business problem and work with data scientists to effectively translate it into a data science problem
Co-lead the planning, development, documentation, and day-to-day management of an AI solution project plan that effectively prioritizes goals and objectives
Work hand-in-hand with data scientists to ensure the inputs and outputs of the AI solution suit the intended user experience and audit workflow, and address the root cause of the defined business problem
Manage developers and guide data scientists in designing the user experience of the AI-enhanced audit workflow
Tag datasets or supervise and review the tagging of datasets in order to produce high-quality training data for supervised ML models
Present progress updates and lead technical demonstrations to Audit Transformation and senior firm leaders
Design and lead pilot programs that solicit feedback from audit engagement teams
Present to the broader Audit practice regarding artificial intelligence and the solutions we build
Manage the production and publishing of internal and external eminence regarding artificial intelligence in the Deloitte Audit
Qualifications
Required:
A bold, creative mindset – we will be exploring technologies and techniques that represent a new way of thinking
A demonstrated interest in technology or process transformation
Strong project management capabilities
Strong understanding of technical auditing requirements
Ability to visualize and create user experience process flowcharts and data flowcharts (Visio, etc.)
Experience producing and presenting high-quality PowerPoint slide materials
Ability to travel when necessary
Preferred:
Previous experience in a technical National Office role (Audit & Assurance Services or Accounting & Reporting Services), or an Audit Transformation role
Demonstrable history of designing custom analytics, analyses, VBA scripts, or other automation routines within your audits
Experience with coding and advanced quantitative modeling – Python preferred, though other languages (R, SAS, etc.) also useful
Experience with software and/or web development (HTML, JavaScript, JSON)
Familiarity with artificial intelligence and machine learning concepts
Real-world experience with Omnia and Omnia|Cortex
Experience with Agile Methodology or Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe)

Company Description

Bosch Global Software Technologies Private Limited is a 100% owned subsidiary of Robert Bosch GmbH, one of the world's leading global supplier of technology and services, offering end-to-end Engineering, IT and Business Solutions. With over 20K+ associates, it’s the largest software development center of Bosch, outside Germany, indicating that it is the Technology Powerhouse of Bosch in India with a global footprint and presence in the US, Europe and the Asia Pacific region.

Job Description

As five-star service provider for our internal divisions, Bosch Global Business Services offers End-to-End processes that ensure the best possible customer experience. Our long-term aim is to process all services from anywhere in the world and provide our solutions around the clock. Working with us means being part of a diverse team, with dynamic colleagues as digital innovation center for internal business processes driving success together. Join our team as Future-Makers, Solution Innovators and Design Thinkers and help us to offer services that empower people to create technology that is invented for life.
Activities:
As a Data Scientist you will work as part of our global Data Science team to provide data driven AI solutions for our internal customers using state-of-the-art Machine Learning methods and tools.
In collaboration with other Bosch units, you will enhance and operate our existing cloud-based solutions as well as explore new potential Machine Learning use cases.
As an employee of the global cross Business Intelligence team (xBI), you will work on the future steering of Bosch together with Data Modelers, Data Engineers, and Business Analysts.
Last but not least, as part of the leading in-house provider for data and analytics-based solutions within Bosch, you will experience the start-up spirit with us and make your contribution through entrepreneurial thinking and acting.

Qualifications
Education: Masters or bachelor’s degree in software engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or comparable qualification
Experience: At least 2 years of experience of professional data science.
Know-How: Extensive know-how of Python, (R is a plus) and in object-oriented programming languages with high code quality (Clean Code). Proven track record in machine learning, neural networks, pattern analysis, time series forecasting, data analysis as well as data-pipeline technologies (e.g., Kubernetes, Docker, NoSQL-Databases, Workflow-Engine). Would you like to be part of a team that seeks the stories in data that illuminate big investments that will best serve and delight clients? JPMorgan Chase needs curious, passionate data scientists to drive the transformation of data into insights that identify \"aha!\" moments and enable business breakthroughs.

The Data & Analytics team is the engine that powers JPMorgan Chase with insights to create competitive advantages for our business and deliver value for our customers. We have unified data and analytics talent across the firm and encompass a variety of disciplines including data science, reporting, quantitative analytics, and data governance. Within this organization, the Data Sciences team leverages industry-leading data-driven techniques to convert data into meaningful insights that enable the firm

The industry is rapidly changing and JPMorgan Chase is transforming our wealth management business to accelerate growth. We are looking for talented data scientists to help execute our analytic strategies for the newly formed JPMorgan Wealth Management (JPMWM) business unit which includes Chase Wealth Management, JP Morgan Advisors, and the You Invest digital platforms. This role will be central in understanding investment customers' financial needs and their interactions with our products, services, channels and Advisors.

Job responsibilities
Searching for collections of behaviors and events that are innocuous but collectively indicate a likely next action in order to enable timely, relevant outreach. Collaboration with technology and design partners in product agile framework

Predicting a segment's unique financial needs within the first 3 months on book to improve engagement and deepening with new clients
Overlaying customer and channel behaviors across our local markets and branch footprint to determine how to optimize in-person and remote staffing
Providing expertise as to how data visualization, greedy algorithms, machine learning, and text analytics/NLP can be leveraged to optimize sales performance
Creating self-serve tools to put real-time information
Identifying potential attrition events and determining how early the prediction needs to be made for any counteraction to be effective

Bachelor's / Master's Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data or Information Science, or related quantitative analytic field with 7+ years of data science experience
Expertise in SAS / Python programming to develop advanced analytical techniques
Experience in wrangling large, complex datasets, strong database skills and ability to write, optimize and tune complex SQL scripts
Experience in solving business problems through fact-based and scientific analytics, like to focus on solving problems
Experience in Digital product Analytics and hands-on Adobe Analytics
Ability to think both independently and collaboratively to implement creative solutions that solve business problems, being diligent in the detail while maintaining focus on broader purpose and business objectives
Recognize the stories in the data and tell them in ways that illuminate which customers are likely to do what next. Comfortable summarizing key information and presenting recommendations to multiple stakeholders to influence senior management

Who you are

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join us in developing new revolutionizing ways for IKEA to make strategic business decisions based on proactive performance management. We are using cutting edge methodologies within cross-functional teams to keep IKEA leading in an
exciting and fast-moving environment. Our diverse and global team within Data & Analytics is growing even more and we would
love to talk with you, if you recognize yourself in some of the following:
You consider data to be the starting point for solving (almost) any business problem, and you are passionate about the possibilities of data & analytics
Enjoy applying your knowledge in SQL and programming (e.g. in Python) to work with large datasets
Love to dig deep into data, to apply advanced visualization tools and to tell compelling data stories to non-technical stakeholders
Experience with cloud platforms like Google Cloud Platform, AWS or Azure
Love to dig deep into data, to apply advanced visualization tools and to tell compelling data stories to non-technical stakeholders
Are passionate about applying a scientific mindset to solve business problems and to guide product development using experimentation, statistics and statistical modelling
Able to perform work with a balanced trade-off between care and speed, in rapid validated learning cycles to optimize performance in the long term
A team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge with more junior team members
Are a curious world class problem solver who wants to keep learning!
Have at least 3 years relevant experience as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Web Analyst or similar
Preferably an educational background in applied mathematics, computer science, data science, engineering or equivalent (MS or equivalent)
Experience in applying Bayesian statistics and market mix modeling is a strong bonus (but not a hard requirement)
Excellent communication skills with both technical and business audiences, including senior stakeholders
Agile product development and experience working in cross-functional teams

This is our wish list! If you don’t recognize yourself in all these points, you might still be an excellent candidate for the role. We like to think long-term and invest in people’s development together with us.
The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day to day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it’s important for us that you share our values! You can read more regarding our values and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com

What you'll be doing day to day

You’ll lead the transformation of IKEA into a more data driven company by extracting and sharing insights from data that reinforce, alter, or largely impact decisions on business and product strategy, leading to a better experience for our customers. You’ll apply the latest principles of data storytelling by combining data, narrative and visuals to drive change.
For example, we are developing metrics, models, dashboards and tools to answer questions like:
Measure, understand, and drive business performance across the P&L
How will extraordinary events like a pandemic affect our sales and operations? How should we react?
Where should we open the next IKEA store to become more accessible to the many people?
What will the IKEA store of tomorrow look like?
Stay profitable while changing store formats, omnichannel customer journeys and distribution methods
How do we get the most out of our commercial activities?
Use data and analytics to enhance cost-consciousness in all our markets
Optimally distribute budget into our operations and developments
Help top management with advanced analytics to steer the enterprise for optimal value creation

And perhaps you have your own ideas on problems to solve? We are on a journey towards becoming a data-driven company and you will have the opportunity to help shape our path, based on your knowledge and experience.

Our team within ikea

You will work in Data & Analytics together with other Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Data Stewards and Data Architects. Together you will be joining cross-functional product teams consisting of colleagues from Technology, Product and Design from the Business Support domain. All of you together will be creating the best solutions to support strategic enterprise decisions, financial forecasting and business support.
IKEA has long been a global leader in home furnishing. We are proud of our vision to improve the everyday life of the many people. But our industry is quickly changing, and we need to adapt to stay competitive. To facilitate our digital growth ambition, we are working in different locations world-wide. The home office for this role will be Bangalore, India, but we act as one global team and work together on global solutions.
We see so many opportunities for what we can accomplish and have the ambition to be a world class team. At the same time, we believe that our work is not just about solving business problems, but also about learning and having fun together.

Work on exciting problems as described above, and you are encouraged to spot new opportunities or to collaborate with Data & Analytics colleagues in other specialist teams
Opportunities to have global impact with your work
Flexible and modern tools: we deploy on Google Cloud Platform and we use a lot of open-source tools across the board
Your choice between Mac and Windows
A team of great colleagues to learn with and from (with world-class experience across all aspects of Data & Analytics)
Continuous learning (we aim to spend 20% of our working time on learning)
Flexible, sustainable and friendly working environment in a truly value-based company
Fantastic career opportunities in a large global organization, with a servant leadership style and lots of possibilities to take ownership
Relocation support where applicable

SailPoint is the Worldwide Leader for Enterprise-Class IAM (Identity and Access Management). We minimize risk and maximize business growth by managing access to data and resources across our client’s enterprise. We do it effectively and securely for every person who interacts with our client’s organization—any user, on any device, anywhere in the world.
We were first to recognize that companies could benefit from an approach to identity that addresses both IT and business priorities. We developed a unique, risk-based model and leveraged that approach for everything from compliance to user provisioning. Then we followed that with the industry's first solution for truly extending enterprise identity management to applications in the cloud.
Today, we offer comprehensive products that can handle enterprise IAM on-premises or as a cloud-based service. This gives you the freedom to choose the best solution for your current needs, while at the same time establishing a clear path for future growth.
The ideal candidate on the DevOps team will be a self-starter who enjoys a fast-paced job, thrives on problem solving, and is committed to delivering seamless product availability to large enterprises around the world.
Responsibilities:

Interview and participate in building a team to establish a center of excellence and expertise in the Monitoring and Observability domains
Monitoring and incident response for distributed applications
Collaborate with developers to bring new features and services into production
Utilize a combination of open-source and custom software to solve product challenges
Serve as a mentor to junior engineers
Write and maintain architectural, stakeholder, and policy documentation
Proactively meet standards for information security and compliance, such as ISO, SOX, SSAE 16, etc.
Background & Experience:
Experience in 24x7 production operations, preferably supporting a highly available environment for a SaaS or cloud service provider
Experience with cloud infrastructure environments, preferably AWS
Extensive experience with logging, metrics and distributed tracing systems (e.g. Prometheus/Grafana/ElasticSearch/Honeycomb)
Experience working across departments evangelizing and communicating observability expertise and standards
Experience with containerization technology including: Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS ECS
Release automation (Jenkins, Argo, etc.), system administration, system configuration, and system debugging experience
Experience infrastructure-as-code tools (Terraform)
Strong understanding of system and networking concepts and troubleshooting techniques
Strong interpersonal and teaming skills - ability to set and enforce process and influence engineers who are not direct reports.
Ability to operate in an agile, entrepreneurial start-up environment.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or other technical discipline, or equivalent experience
5+ years of DevOps experience

The quality of Investment’s data, processes and software is critically important to achieve business results. YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
Plan, document and execute test cases using business requirements or in some cases undefined/loosely defined requirements as needed. Experience using a Test Management solution such as PractiTest, ALM or equivalent. Prioritize and sequence test case execution according to defined test strategy and milestones. 2+ years’ experience in software testing and documenting test cases. Preferably some experience with back end/database and comparison testing.

Job Summary:
We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Research Associate to join our team of scientists and engineers. The successful candidate will work on projects focused on materials science, conducting research and experiments to develop new materials, improve existing ones, and solve problems related to materials properties and performance. The Research Associate will collaborate with other team members and support the development of innovative solutions for materials-related challenges.
Responsibilities:
To perform experiments and Conduct research in the field of materials science.
Develop and optimize synthesis and processing methods for the creation of new materials.
Characterize materials using various analytical techniques such as X-ray diffraction, spectroscopy, microscopy, optical and electrical techniques.
Analyze and interpret experimental data, and report findings to the project leaders.
Collaborate with other team members, design, and execute experiments in consultation with the leads.
Write reports and prepare presentations on research findings for internal and external stakeholders.
Maintain laboratory equipment and ensure compliance with safety protocols.
Contribute to the preparation of grant proposals and research publications.
Keep up-to-date with the latest developments in the field of materials science.
Essential Qualifications:
Master’s degree in Chemistry, Physics, Materials Science, or a related field.
Strong knowledge of materials science principles and experimental techniques.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Desirable Qualifications:
One or two years of experience in working in a project focused on materials science
Experience with materials characterization techniques such as X-ray diffraction, spectroscopy, and microscopy.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
We offer a competitive salary and the opportunity to work in an interdisciplinary, and dynamic research environment. If you are passionate about research in materials science and have the skills and experience we are looking for, we encourage you to apply.
Please send us your CV with the subject line as “Research Associate-Materials Science” to the following address careers@prayoga.org.in

We are looking for an AI/ML Intern to join our team and help us develop and implement machine learning solutions for our business needs. As an AI/ML Intern, you will be responsible for assisting the team in the following tasks:
All internships are 3 months (remote), have stipends and post-internship PPO will be given based on performance with a salary increment.
Responsibilities:
Work with our engineering team to understand the business problem, and define the input data, output data, and performance metrics for the model.
Collect, annotate, or obtain relevant data and pre-process it to prepare it for training the model, including cleaning the data, removing duplicates, filling in missing values, and encoding categorical variables.
Choose an appropriate algorithm or model architecture based on the nature of the problem and the data, experiment with different algorithms to determine the one that works best, and evaluate it for customization and use.
Train the model on the pre-processed data using an appropriate training algorithm, adjust the model parameters to minimize the error or loss function, and evaluate its performance on a separate validation dataset to ensure it can generalize to new data.
Fine-tune the hyperparameters of the model to optimize its performance, including adjusting the learning rate, batch size, or regularization parameters. Deploy the model in a production environment, integrate it into the business application or system, and test it to ensure it performs as expected.
Monitor the performance of the model in production, periodically update it as needed to ensure it continues to deliver accurate results and collaborate with the engineering team to improve its performance.
Qualifications:
Currently pursuing or recently graduated with a degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras.
Familiarity with object detection algorithms such as YOLO, Faster R-CNN, or SSD.
Experience with data pre-processing, cleaning, and annotation.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Matplotlib or Seaborn. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
The ideal candidate should possess strong skills in computer vision, including experience with the OpenCV library for image and video processing tasks.

Globals has drastically grown from a small home office to a globally recognized enterprise offering world-class quality solutions on Cybersecurity, ERP Systems, Predictive Analytics, and Enterprise Application Development for various industries including Defence, Education, Government, Financial Services and Transport Industries. Globals has enabled its customers to be game-changers in their industry through its disruptive and innovative solutions.
Globals is certified as a "Great Place to Work" organization for its laudable work culture that helps its team members manage work-life, have dedicated hours to upskill and reskill themselves, and most important to ensure that the projects that they are working on are always unique, challenging their status quo every time. Our unique work culture has made us one of the world’s fastest-growing technology companies as recognized and featured by The Economist.
Our excellence in technical stewardship and service-offering expertise has facilitated our clients ranging from individual entrepreneurs to Fortune Global 500 – to explore new business opportunities, reduce their operational costs significantly and boost their revenues. Today, Globals enjoys a strong position in the industry as a high-performing leader through its technology innovation and remarkable domain expertise. Globals is a CMMI Level 3 certified company.
About the Job Role:
We are looking for a Data Analyst that will helps our clients discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data and help them make smarter decisions to deliver better services to their customers and citizens. Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis and building high quality prediction systems integrated with Third Party Products. Your role will involve using machine learning techniques for predictive & prescriptive analytics, build recommendation systems and to visualize the analysis into dashboards.
Responsibilities:
Using data mining to extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patterns
Organizing and transforming data into insight
Create solutions and strategies to business problems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systemss
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
Using data to find trends and build predictive analytic models in our dataset
Using tools and techniques to visualize data to inform decisions for different stakeholders
Preparing reports and presenting these to clients
Build and monitoring data quality processes
Communicating with stakeholders to understand data content and business requirements
Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
Architect, implement, and monitor data pipelines, as well as conduct knowledge sharing sessions with peers to ensure effective data use
Requirements:
Good knowledge of SQL
2 Years of Experience and coding knowledge of R or Python
Hands on Experience of SQL and noSQL databases
Working knowledge of Power BI
Ability to learn new software and technologies quickly
Ability to follow instructions and work in a team environment
2-3 years' experience in process improvement and automation
Strong and in-depth understanding of statistics, data analytics,
Data analysis experience
Superior analytical and problem solving skills
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Able to work in fast pace continuously evolving environment and ready to take up uphill challenges
Is able to understand cross cultural differences and can work with clients across the globe
Bachelor's/Master's degree in economics, mathematics, computer science/engineering, operations research or related analytics areas

Who you are

We are looking for Data Engineers who are passionate about data and the opportunities building data-focused systems. As a problem-solver you enjoy digging into and understanding data and code as well as building high-quality solutions that deliver value to users. As a person you get energized by working together with others in a cross-functional team towards a shared goal. You have a growth mindset which drives you to lead by example and continuously renew and improve ways of working.
Our diverse and global team within Data & Analytics is growing even more and we would love to talk with you, if you recognize yourself in some of the following:

The role requires 4+ years of relevant experience.
Extensive experience in designing and implementing scalable, distributed and resilient data processing systems.
Strong knowledge of database systems and data storage technologies
Extensive experience in any of the mentioned cloud platforms (GCP/AWS/Azure).
Strong knowledge of SQL for data processing and analysis
Extensive experience in collaborative software engineering practices (Git, Agile, DevOps), in which solutions evolve through the effort of self-organising cross-functional teams.
Good knowledge of data analysis and business intelligence products and how they rely on data feeds for their implementation.
Broad knowledge of digital product development principles and the importance of rapid validated learning cycles to optimise performance long term.
A team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships with senior peers and loves sharing knowledge with more junior team members.
A curious world class problem solver who wants to keep learning!
Excellent communication skills with both technical and business audiences, including senior stakeholders.
Agile product development and experience working in cross-functional teams.

The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day-to-day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it’s important for us that you share our values! You can read more regarding our values and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com

What you'll be doing day to day

You’ll lead the transformation of IKEA into a more data driven company by ensuring that data and insights are frequently and widely used in product teams in Group Digital to reinforce, alter, or largely impact present and future decisions on business and product strategy.

As a Data Engineer you will work closely with Software Engineers and Data Analysts to drive the development of data products within the People Domain. You will work hands-on with building data pipelines in our data mesh on Google Cloud Platform, as well as be a thought partner on points like:

Work on designing, developing, testing and maintaining data processing systems and services that meet requirements and user needs
Implement measures to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality, and ensuring that systems are reliable and secured
Drive data ingestion and processing from a variety of sources systems, to prepare for usage in reporting, analysis and machine learning/data science applications
Educate team members in cross-functional teams about the importance of data reliability, security, and quality
Be an active member and contributor in our data engineering community

Together as a team

The Data & Analytics team enables and drives IKEA’s digital agenda through data and analytics, from reporting and analysis solutions to real-time streaming data and machine learning systems that enable personalized experiences for our customers. We work end-to-end over the digital product lifecycle in cross-functional teams, using new and existing technologies and practices to deliver at speed.

We are a diverse team coming from all over the world with a shared passion for data and analytics. We work hard with a spirit of togetherness and enthusiasm, and we have fun doing it in an inclusive, open, honest and down-to-earth work environment.

We are currently modernizing our technology landscape including new tools, cloud platforms and open-source technologies and standards. Our data and analytics systems are primarily built in Python and Scala on Google Cloud Platform where we leverage BigQuery, DataFlow/Apache Beam, Spark, Composer/Apache Airflow, Kafka and Google Pub/Sub.

What you need to know

Work on some exciting problems as described above, and you are encouraged to spot new opportunities or to collaborate with Data & Analytics colleagues in other specialist teams
Opportunities to have global impact with your work
Flexible and modern tools: we deploy on Google Cloud Platform and we use a lot of open-source tools across the board
Hardware and Operating System your choice
A team of great colleagues to learn with and from (with world-class experience across all aspects of Data & Analytics)
Continuous learning (we aim to spend 20% of our working time on learning)
Flexible and friendly working environment in a truly value-based company

PayU, a leading payment and Fintech company in 50+ high-growth markets throughout Asia, Central and Eastern Europe, Latin America, the Middle East and Africa, part of Prosus group, one of the largest technology investors in the world is redefining the way people buy and sell online for our 300.000+ merchants and millions of consumers.

ole: Data Analyst

About the Role:
We are looking for a Data Analyst
About the team:
PayU Finance is the credit and lending arm of the PayU brand (a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Prosus group. Previously Naspers group) headquartered in Amsterdam, Netherlands. PayU Finance India has disbursed about 20 billion loans to date by volume and has disbursed more than $280 million in consumer credit. Excited yet? Continue reading to find out more about the role:

Someone who can work both independently and in collaboration with the team as and when the situation demands for it.
Someone who is not averse to learning and growth and has an open mind about inputs/suggestions from any stakeholder.

We are seeking a highly skilled data scientist to join our team and lead the implementation of our proprietary Big Data Machine Learning solution in the financial crime space. About Print Analytics
As part of HP’s R&D Center, the Print Analytics Team works closely with our GBU partners across multiple domains. We provide data-driven actionable insights to influence business decisions.
The Print Analytics Team seeks to deliver insightful analysis derived from a thorough understanding of the data, business & customer environment, utilizing business intelligence tools and advanced analysis methods, as needed.
Business Environment
Our team partners closely with the Instant Ink organization to deliver analytics and insights on our program and partner performance. The Instant Ink program is an ink & toner subscription model offered by HP to its home and SMB customers, in which customers select from different page plans and ink / toner gets home delivered to them as and when their printer detects they are running out of supplies.
To manage channel contra payment, we are looking for a high caliber Data Engineer who can work in close collaboration with cross-functional and cross-regional teams and help efficiently program manage contra payment.
Role Description:
Be a systems expert and a technical business intelligence (BI) consultant to the Instant Ink (II) Business Intelligence and Operations team.
The core objective of the engagement would be to help the program better understand our channel partners & contra program by enabling analytics that provide insights into partners, their performance, the compensation process and opportunities to optimize in each of these areas. To ensure streamlined analytics delivery, we require a data platform and system that can sustain and adapt to the growing analytics needs, by designing systems, automation frameworks and smart systems.
Key responsibilities:
Technical -
Ownership of our web-based cloud portal that provides payment processing of retailer channel partners i.e. become the technical product owner for this Retailer Compensation (RC) Tool
Own the technical responsibilities for the E2E data stack related to the I-Ink compensation program (data engineering, front end development, analytics onboarding, and delivery, etc.)
Complete familiarity with the existing BI systems, retailer compensation processes, data stack, data sources (internal and external), dashboards, and analysis
Key goal is to leverage the gained knowledge to showcase technical leadership and deliver a future ready, strategic roadmap for the tool development, delivery and optimization
Program manage the data systems development roadmap aimed at continuous improvement – e.g. adapting to the newer technologies, developing POCs, team management of roles and responsibilities, etc.
Analyze, design and determine coding, programming, and integration activities required based on specific objectives and established project guidelines
Work with team to design, implement and maintain Java applications (Front end as well as backend code) with core responsibilities on backend data processing
Execute and write portions of testing plans, protocols, and documentation for assigned portion of application; identify and debugs issues with code and suggests changes or improvements.
Deliver automation capabilities for data mining and reporting, and improve analytics delivery
Participate as a member of a project team with other engineers, data science & business professionals to develop reliable, cost effective and high-quality solutions for assigned data system, model, or component.
Business -
Close collaboration with Instant Ink team to understand and internalize the program challenges and opportunities to enable translation of business needs to technical requirements and roadmaps
Develop a thorough understanding of the retail partner relationships and dependencies that drive and influence the Instant Ink business performance
Collaborate and communicate with project team regarding project progress and issue resolution.
Be creative and a thought leader in developing data solutions for newer business challenges as HP forays into newer spaces.
Education and Experience Required:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or equivalent.
3-6 years of experience in Data Engineering, Exposure to AWS Big Data Platform
2-3 years of experience in building Java based Application, front end UI
Qualifications and key skills required:
Using data engineering tools, languages, frameworks to cleanse, mine and explore data
Understanding of database technologies, management systems, and cloud-based systems/services.
Database architecture testing methodology, including execution of test plans, debugging, and testing scripts and tools.
Fluent in programming and automating repetitive tasks – preferably using Knime/Nifi/Airflow/Databricks
Expert in writing script for automated QA/Testing
Proficient in R/Python scripting, SQL programming languages experience
Experience with AWS big data systems, PySpark, and Apache NiFi, ETL is a required
Exposure with Java application development
Working experience in Java 8 or higher, Hibernate and Spring MVC is a plus
Strong written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English and local language.
Ability to effectively communicate design proposals and negotiate options.

About 9ine
9ine is an EdTech consultancy supporting schools around the globe with technology related cyber security, data protection, safeguarding, risk and compliance solutions. Our head office is based in London with satellite offices in North America, and India which enable effective service provision to our expanding client portfolio across the UK, in Europe, Asia, Africa and North America. At the heart of our growth strategy lies the development of our 9ine App that is transforming how schools and SMEs manage their data privacy, cyber security and technology services.
Developed in-house, the 9ine App translates our 12+ years of experience in IT and privacy consultancy into a centralised GRC software platform. Our App automates risk and compliance processes for data privacy. Additional modules for safeguarding / child protection and cyber security and technology solutions management are due for launch in 2022. The App also has a range of additional value add services such as Project Management, Task Management and Incident Management.
Why 9ine?
9ine has big plans, by extending its reach to a wider client base around the globe it has a growth strategy to triple its employee headcount and turnover in the next three years.
To deliver our strategic plans we recognise the importance of both attracting and developing talent and as a result we are investing significantly at both a corporate and individual level to ensure we can deliver both the needs of today with the aspirations we have for tomorrow.
In becoming a true global player we understand that great people may not live and work where 9ine has its offices and are adopting blended working to ensure we can extend the opportunity to be part of something truly amazing wherever you are around the world.
In addition to our strong commercial plan we are evolving our ethical footprint. Our plans include reinvesting a percentage of our profits back into education oriented projects around the world.
With big plans comes big opportunity, if you are the kind of person that looking for a challenge, that wants to make an personal impact, that strives for high quality delivery in all you do, and values working for an organisation whose underlying principles are to support the protection of children in the education environment, then 9ine is the place for you.
Why Apply?
It's simple, why wouldn't you? Working for the world leader in its field, an ethical company who truly cares about its people and the people it serves, while being well rewarded for your contribution and developed from the moment you land…..
I know what you're thinking….. Where do I sign?

About the Inspire Global Innovation Center
Inspire Brands is disrupting the restaurant industry through digital transformation and operational efficiencies. The companys technology hub, the Inspire Global Innovation Center in Hyderabad, India, will lead technology innovation and product development for the organization and its portfolio of distinct brands. The Inspire Global Innovation Center will focus on developing new capabilities in data science, data analytics, eCommerce, automation, cloud computing, and information security to accelerate the companys business strategy. Inspire Global Innovation Center will also host an innovation lab and collaborate with start-ups to develop solutions for productivity optimization, workforce management, loyalty management, payments systems, and more.
Job Description
PURPOSE OF THE POSITION
Inspire Brands is looking for Data Architect, a self-driven senior technical professional to collaborate with our business, Product and Development teams and help qualify, identify, and build Data & Analytics solutions. As part of Enterprise Data Team, this position is responsible for actively defining robust, efficient, scalable and innovation solutions that are custom fit to our needs.

Job Summary

Play a key role working with product and business teams to understand their strategic, business, and technical needs
Define technical architecture roadmaps which help realize business values in both tactical and strategic ways
Define and continuously update architecture principles in line with business and technology needs
Design solutions involving data architectures based on established principles. Architectures include but not limited to data lake, data fabric, dimensional marts, MDM, etc.
Create data flow diagrams and details to establish data lineage and help educate team members in a clear and articulate manner
Partner with technical leads to identify solution components and latest data related technologies that best meet business requirements
Identify gaps in the environment, process, and skills with the intent to address, educate, and bring teams together to drive results
Become a thought leader by educating and sharing best practices, architecture patterns, building deep relationships with technical leaders, contributing to publications, white papers, conferences, etc.
Provide support to enterprise data infrastructure management and analysts to ensure development of efficient data systems utilizing established standards, procedures and methodologies
Create cloud data models and database architecture using database deployment, monitoring automation code, and for long term technical viability of cloud master data management integrated repositories
Suggest ideas to improve system performance and cost reduction
Communicate data architecture to stakeholders and collaborate and coordinate with other technical staff
Ensures adherence to Enterprise data movement, quality and accountability standards in technology
Conducts data driven analyses of usage of detailed data elements across the business domain to provide optimal data provisioning patterns across the application space
Possesses excellent quantitative /analytic skills and are able to influence strategic direction, as well as develop tactical plans
Improving and streamlining processes regarding data flow and data quality to improve data accuracy, viability and value

This position will have strong Oracle Hyperion experience and will design, execute and support
software application designs throughout project life cycles within Oracle Hyperion tool set and architecture. In addition, this individual will provide Production and perform root cause analysis to avoid recurrence. The
Oracle Hyperion Developer will work with IT Leads, Business users and other IT team members to understand and evaluate functional requirements, review technology/application alternatives, and develop technical solutions, designs, coding, testing and support Hyperion implementation and upgrades. Duties and Responsibilities
Development and deployment of integrated solutions to enhance, consolidate, and coordinate independently designed applications enterprise-wide; assist in scheduling and coordinating project deliverables
Follow the Team development and work process procedures and standards
Program design, coding, benchmark testing, debugging, and documentation under general supervision
Setups and configurations of Hyperion planning and supported applications as needed for development and support activities; plan, organize and manage time across multiple priorities working independently
Help maintain interfaces and reports from E-Business suite, Power BI and other third party systems for import/export into the Oracle Hyperion
Assist in Process and data modeling.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex production issues, performing root cause analysis, deliver onto ad-hoc requests, documenting and providing the best solution to the problem

Prepare Functional, Technical Design documents and Unit test documents for the related areas
Perform other duties as assigned

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor of Science degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or a related field
Four or more years of experience developing applications, interfaces and reports using Hyperion planning, Essbase, DRM, Hyperion Financial Reporting under Oracle Hyperion environment (preferably Release 11.2.2 or later)
Worked with Hyperion Planning in developing web-based forms for the various budgeting and forecasting purpose.
Six or more years of Information Technology experience in any IT role
. Please note that work location of this position is open for Bechtel Offices located in Gurgaon and Chennai.

Job Summary
As a Sr Data Engineer on the Marketing Data Platforms team, you will be working on a team to bring customer-centric personalization to life. In this role, you will be empowered to develop data solutions in support of analytics, data science, and business partners to understand capability requirements and develop data solutions based on priorities. This leading technical and architecture role will collaborate with product managers, architects, technology teams, analysts, marketing operations specialists, and monetization business partners to understand capabilities and that will be brought to life for Giant Eagle’s 4M+ customers. The ideal candidate will have experience within multiple technology platforms (e. g. GCP, Engagement Platforms, Customer Data Platform, Ad-Tech, etc.) while providing the vision and design for integrating customer data. Additional key skills and qualifications below
Job Description
Primary Job Responsibilities:
5+ years of relevant technical experience working with various data engineering methodologies such as data integration and data pipelines (ETL/ELT) to activate against data at scale.
3+ years of experience of data modeling for analytic projects activities that include design, curation, and management of large datasets
3+ years of experience adeveloping on big data technologies with Spark and Hive, preferably leveraging such as DataBricks, Juypter notebooks, or GCP, AWS, and Azure equivalent technology.
2+ years of experience data solution design for data engineering pipelines
Strong Experience building event driven systems using cloud technology: storage, Pub/Sub, cloud functions, API’s, and DataProc
Expertise with databases experience such as BigQuery, Snowflake, and Synapse designing schema and dimensional data modeling
Experience leveraging RESTful web services to collect and publish data.
Experience in software engineering development and testing life cycles using but not limited to Python, R, Linux, Java, JavaScript, Lambda, and SQL programming
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or other technical field or equivalent work experience. Advanced degree a plus
Experience with Retail Media Networks and Ad Tech preferred
Role Requirements:
Architect, develop and implement end-to-end complex data projects and technical solutions through translating business requirements into technical solutions and data-flow architectures.
Architect, build and automate data pipelines that clean, transform, and aggregate unorganized data into data sources that are ready for analysis.
Use expertise to apply various analytic methods to discover and interpret information about customer behavior from multiple data sources to implement analytics solutions
Use expertise in database design to implement, operate stable and scalable dataflows from multiple marketing platforms into a cloud data lake for Ad Tech
Experience building data visualization tools Tableau, PowerBI, and Looker with data modeling and Looker ML preferred
Design, implement and deploy data applications and mechanisms using big data technology
Provides subject matter expertise for multiple projects concurrently through all phases of the development lifecycle.
Develop, enhance, govern, and administer for data platform to: collect data, transform, enrich, unify, segment, and integrate data
Strong adherence data ethics rules around PII data sets
Work collaboratively with IT teams, Performance Marketing team, and business leaders to ensure actionable is provided key stakeholders
Research and analyze customer behavior data to improve customer experience
Experience with agile or other rapid application development methods a plus
Retail industry experience a plus
About the Company
Since our founding in 1931, Giant Eagle, Inc. has evolved into one of the top 40 largest private corporations in the U. S. and one of the country’s largest food retailers and distributors. With more than 37,000 Team Members and $9.7 billion in revenue, we are committed to investing in people, technology, and data to elevate our customer’s experience across multiple touchpoints. It helps us follow on our commitment to serving others and improving our communities.
About Giant Eagle Bangalore
The Giant Eagle GCC in Bangalore is our global capability center. Our team of more than 370 members at the GCC enables us to expand internal capabilities in the areas such as data analytics, merchandising and eCommerce, quality engineering, and automation to generate insights for faster decision-making and helping us accelerate our business strategy. Our team in India plays a pivotal role in helping the company transition to new ways of working by redefining the food and grocery shopping experience for over 4.6 million customers.
About Us
At Giant Eagle Inc., we’re more than just food, fuel and convenience. We’re one giant family of diverse and talented Team Members. Our people are the heart and soul of our company. It’s why we strive to create a nurturing environment that offers countless career opportunities to grow. Deep caring and solid family values are what makes us one of the top work places for jobs in the Greater Pittsburgh, Cleveland, Columbus and Indianapolis Areas. From our Warehouses to our GetGo’s, our grocery Stores through our Corporate home office, we are working together to put food on shoppers' tables and smiles on their faces. We’re always searching for the best Team Members to welcome to our family. We invite you to join our Giant Eagle family. Come start a lasting career with us.

Role Description
As a Senior Database Developer you will design, develop, test, and implement effective and secure database solutions and models to store and retrieve company data to a high quality standard. You must be able to maintain existing systems whilst developing new solutions in line with the business requirements. You should be self-sufficient and be able to guide more junior developers at a technical level. You will work as part of a collaborative Agile development team, which will include Product Owners, a Scrum Master, Developers and UX/UX Design staff on the frontend, database and back-end elements of the 9ine App which is used by customers all over the world. You must have a can-do attitude and be willing to grow and adapt as the business grows its software service offering.
Responsibilities
You will be responsible for:
Collaboratively working within a team to develop solutions aligned with the business needs.
Taking business requirements and turning them into technical solutions.
Mentoring and training team members and ensuring they develop to quality standards.
Developing, implementing and maintaining solutions that are both reliable and scalable.
Recommending improvements to new and existing systems.
Ensuring compliance to code implementation procedures.
Documenting technical solutions in line with agreed quality standards.
Maintaining application performance.
Troubleshooting issues and carrying out root cause analysis.
Performing code and design reviews as per the code review process.
Optimising the integration and installation of new releases.
Migrating data from legacy systems to new solutions.
Providing regular updates.
Skills and Experience
6+ years of experience in database management and development.
Relevant qualifications in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.
Strong knowledge of data structures and database systems.
In depth expertise and hands on experience with Microsoft SQL Database Management System.
In depth expertise and hands on experience in database design, data maintenance, database security, data analysis and mining.
Hands-on experience with at least one web-hosting platform such as AWS (Amazon Web Services), Microsoft Azure, etc.
Strong understanding of security principles and how they apply to web applications.
Basic knowledge of networking.
Desirable knowledge of business intelligence (MSBI).
Desirable knowledge of data architectures related to data warehouse implementations.
Experience of working in Agile delivery model using Jira as the work management tool.
Fluency in both written and verbal English.
Strong interpersonal skills and a desire to work collaboratively to achieve objectives.
Understanding of Agile methodologies.
Excellent analytical skills.
Strong organisational skills.
Excellent problem-solving abilities.
Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills.
Value Add
Exposure to relevant subject matters, including: Enterprise Data Systems, AI, Machine Learning.
Experience of working effectively with global teams.
Professional Development Responsibilities
You will be required to:
Make recommendations about areas of improvement or development within the business.
Drive personal continued professional development in line with the business objectives.
Provide training and support to colleagues within the business and ensure their continuous development.
Identify new trends in technologies and structure training strategies for the team to help them adopt it.
Other Responsibilities
You will need to:
Undertake any other duties as reasonably required.
Work with other departments and colleagues to aid the successful completion of business priorities.
Work effectively as part of the 9ine team.
Showcase excellent organisational skills.
Think on your feet and use your initiative.
Maintain an enthusiastic and positive attitude.
Maintain strong interpersonal skills in order to build and develop relationships.
Have strong communication and presentation skills.
About 9ine
9ine is an EdTech consultancy supporting schools around the globe with technology related cyber security, data protection, safeguarding, risk and compliance solutions. Our head office is based in London with satellite offices in North America, and India which enable effective service provision to our expanding client portfolio across the UK, in Europe, Asia, Africa and North America. At the heart of our growth strategy lies the development of our 9ine App that is transforming how schools and SMEs manage their data privacy, cyber security and technology services.
Developed in-house, the 9ine App translates our 12+ years of experience in IT and privacy consultancy into a centralised GRC software platform. Our App automates risk and compliance processes for data privacy. Additional modules for safeguarding / child protection and cyber security and technology solutions management are due for launch in 2022. The App also has a range of additional value add services such as Project Management, Task Management and Incident Management.
Why 9ine?
9ine has big plans, by extending its reach to a wider client base around the globe it has a growth strategy to triple its employee headcount and turnover in the next three years.
To deliver our strategic plans we recognise the importance of both attracting and developing talent and as a result we are investing significantly at both a corporate and individual level to ensure we can deliver both the needs of today with the aspirations we have for tomorrow.
In becoming a true global player we understand that great people may not live and work where 9ine has its offices and are adopting blended working to ensure we can extend the opportunity to be part of something truly amazing wherever you are around the world.
In addition to our strong commercial plan we are evolving our ethical footprint. Our plans include reinvesting a percentage of our profits back into education oriented projects around the world.
With big plans comes big opportunity, if you are the kind of person that looking for a challenge, that wants to make an personal impact, that strives for high quality delivery in all you do, and values working for an organisation whose underlying principles are to support the protection of children in the education environment, then 9ine is the place for you.
Why Apply?
It's simple, why wouldn't you? Working for the world leader in its field, an ethical company who truly cares about its people and the people it serves, while being well rewarded for your contribution and developed from the moment you land…..
I know what you're thinking….. Where do I sign?

About the Inspire Global Innovation Center
Inspire Brands is disrupting the restaurant industry through digital transformation and operational efficiencies. The companys technology hub, the Inspire Global Innovation Center in Hyderabad, India, will lead technology innovation and product development for the organization and its portfolio of distinct brands. The Inspire Global Innovation Center will focus on developing new capabilities in data science, data analytics, eCommerce, automation, cloud computing, and information security to accelerate the companys business strategy. Inspire Global Innovation Center will also host an innovation lab and collaborate with start-ups to develop solutions for productivity optimization, workforce management, loyalty management, payments systems, and more.
Job Description
PURPOSE OF THE POSITION
Inspire Brands is looking for Data Architect, a self-driven senior technical professional to collaborate with our business, Product and Development teams and help qualify, identify, and build Data & Analytics solutions. As part of Enterprise Data Team, this position is responsible for actively defining robust, efficient, scalable and innovation solutions that are custom fit to our needs.

Job Summary

Play a key role working with product and business teams to understand their strategic, business, and technical needs
Define technical architecture roadmaps which help realize business values in both tactical and strategic ways
Define and continuously update architecture principles in line with business and technology needs
Design solutions involving data architectures based on established principles. Architectures include but not limited to data lake, data fabric, dimensional marts, MDM, etc.
Create data flow diagrams and details to establish data lineage and help educate team members in a clear and articulate manner
Partner with technical leads to identify solution components and latest data related technologies that best meet business requirements
Identify gaps in the environment, process, and skills with the intent to address, educate, and bring teams together to drive results
Become a thought leader by educating and sharing best practices, architecture patterns, building deep relationships with technical leaders, contributing to publications, white papers, conferences, etc.
Provide support to enterprise data infrastructure management and analysts to ensure development of efficient data systems utilizing established standards, procedures and methodologies
Create cloud data models and database architecture using database deployment, monitoring automation code, and for long term technical viability of cloud master data management integrated repositories
Suggest ideas to improve system performance and cost reduction
Communicate data architecture to stakeholders and collaborate and coordinate with other technical staff
Ensures adherence to Enterprise data movement, quality and accountability standards in technology
Conducts data driven analyses of usage of detailed data elements across the business domain to provide optimal data provisioning patterns across the application space
Possesses excellent quantitative /analytic skills and are able to influence strategic direction, as well as develop tactical plans

This position is for a Geographic Information Systems (GIS) database administrator and developer to support integration of GIS tools with the digital delivery of GIS-specific deliverables for the customer. The GIS database administrator / developer deploys Bechtel project's GIS functionality and requires a firm understanding of the impacts and security implications of maintaining and operating an ArcGIS enterprise solution. This position requires an advanced level of proficiency and demonstrated experience in ArcGIS Servers, Enterprise GIS geodatabase, programming languages, and spatial analysis using ESRI-based products and open-source products. As the GIS database administrator / developer, the ideal candidate will be involved in geospatial web application development, geospatial analysis, development, and maintenance of GIS deliverables as well as linear project design and mapping and production of design deliverables for the customer.
Responsibilities:
Development of geospatial applications will also involve the integration of available resources and information from our customer's ArcGIS suite of tools.
Various ArcGIS Server and ArcGIS Portal Deployments and Configurations- Will aid in trouble shooting
Familiar with Oracle and SQL Server Databases Environments- Will aid in trouble shooting
Involved in web development languages and protocols such as JavaScript, HTML, AJAX, XML, SQL.
Use python with ESRI’s arcpy module to create script tools to batch process and speed up large-scale data conversions.
Experience using Geospatial applications involves incorporating web maps and web map services using ArcGIS Enterprise into a variety of web applications.
Produce applications including ArcGIS Field Maps, Survey 123, dashboards, and other popular applications that can include a variety of media and data formats to present information on a specific topic.
The ideal candidate must possess a strong background in GIS using ESRI ArcGIS Map's available tools including Analysis and Spatial Analyst.
Programming languages such as C/C++, Python, SQL, Java are required to perform basic programming tasks.
Experience using ArcGIS Pro is a plus.
Additional Responsibilities:
Design, develop, configure, and implement web mapping applications and associated websites using web languages to modify existing functionality.
Performs systems administration functions for web map applications and other technologies that may include GIS services to ensure supported systems are efficiently maintained and available to support Bechtel's project’s needs.
Supports and develops field data collection applications with an emphasis on data management and web-mapping development.
Supports acquisition of field data through a survey.
Supports development and issuance of linear project design deliverables.
Ensures that client security protocols for data management and control are met.
Automates GIS tasks using GIS programming languages and model builder.
Works closely with Bechtel's IT team to upgrade and configure system software that supports GIS infrastructure applications
Performs query, analysis, and reporting activities.
Performs systems administration functions for ArcGIS Enterprise, Web Services including user accounts, permissions of web mapping
applications.
Engages in various project processes involving metadata, spatial analysis, GPS information gathering, data conversions,
Geoprocessing, etc.
Consults, as an SME, by clearly and effectively communicate technical information to non-technical and technical users.
Troubleshoots issues by reviewing logs, performing data queries, recreating steps & interacting with users.
Develops scripting of GIS-based tools for desktop and web-based platforms.
Work with the GIS team and Bechtel's clients to ensure data quality and completeness.
Documents work processes, instructions, and procedures.
Supports strategic GIS team missions and goals and help guide technical vision.
Integrates with engineering, construction, and customer information and data modeling applications.
Basic Qualifications:
BS degree in Geography, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field from an accredited university, with at least 9 years of relevant experience in GIS implementation and data management in linear project design. In lieu of a degree, at least 15 years of relevant experience.

Minimum Qualifications:
Experience as a GIS Specialist, GIS Analyst, or a related field with demonstrated capabilities in GIS.
Experience using the Esri suite of products including ArcGIS Server Advanced or ArcGIS Enterprise, ArcGIS Pro. (Oracle Spatial and Python scripting preferred)
Experience in developing web-based GIS applications.
Must have proficiency working with all geospatial data formats.
Experience of Esri ArcGIS desktop software, including ArcMap and ArcGIS Pro.
Knowledge in the use of various software applications including, ESRI applications ArcTools and model builder.
Knowledge of cartographic procedures and practices.
Knowledge of geography and various methods references common to GIS applications, such as coordinate systems and mapping
standards.
Knowledge of multiple computer operating systems, programs, and architecture.
Knowledge of the principles and techniques of computerized information management, including system design and analysis, programming tools and languages, hardware, software, database applications, and network applications and capabilities.
Knowledge of trends and standards of the computer industry, and relevant local, state and federal regulations
Knowledge of industry and regulatory guides, codes, and standards, Broad knowledge of the application of engineering design
principles.
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written).

Preferred Qualifications:
M.A. or M.S. in Geography, Computer Science, Engineering or related field.
GISP
Professional IT experience in Windows and Web Servers administration.
Experience in SDE and Oracle Spatial enterprise database management.
Experience with data modeling, data conversion and ETL Software such as FME is desired.
Experience working with a variety of vector and raster datasets from public and private sources.
Experience with license management systems such as FlexLM.

Since our founding in 1931, Giant Eagle, Inc. has evolved into one of the top 40 largest private corporations in the U. S. and one of the country’s largest food retailers and distributors. With more than 37,000 Team Members and $9.7 billion in revenue, we are committed to investing in people, technology, and data to elevate our customer’s experience across multiple touchpoints. The Giant Eagle GCC in Bangalore is our global capability center. About Us
At Giant Eagle Inc., we’re more than just food, fuel and convenience. We’re one giant family of diverse and talented Team Members. Our people are the heart and soul of our company. It’s why we strive to create a nurturing environment that offers countless career opportunities to grow. Deep caring and solid family values are what makes us one of the top work places for jobs in the Greater Pittsburgh, Cleveland, Columbus and Indianapolis Areas. From our Warehouses to our GetGo’s, our grocery Stores through our Corporate home office, we are working together to put food on shoppers' tables and smiles on their faces. We’re always searching for the best Team Members to welcome to our family. We invite you to join our Giant Eagle family. Come start a lasting career with us.

About the company:
Viva Books is an independent publisher of quality educational books with nation-wide presence and a sales network covering the whole of South Asia. It publishes and distributes in subject areas like physical sciences, biosciences, computer science, literature, social sciences, medicine, management and subjects of general interest. Viva Books also specializes in school books and children's books. Viva has eight branches across India and has a strong presence in the domestic as well as in the international publishing world. Viva Books recently celebrated its 30th anniversary in 2021.
Focusing on editorial quality and high production values, Viva Education (School Division of Viva Books) publishes books in all major subject areas in school education. With a young, talented and energetic team and an impressive list of titles, Viva is one of the fastest growing and future-oriented organizations in the Indian publishing industry.
Viva VOLT (Viva Online Learning Technologies) is a comprehensive educational programme taking care of the school curriculum, learning at school, self-learning and assessment. High-quality content developed by the best academic minds is delivered through video lessons by skilled presenters and accomplished teachers. Animations and graphical representations make lessons and key concepts come alive. VOLT is an innovative platform for curricular learning. With video and interactive course modules delivered through web, it turns learning into a fun-filled and engaging experience.

Eightfold was founded with a vision to solve for employment in our society. For decades, the connection between individuals and opportunities has been based on who the individuals are and the strength of their network, vs. their potential. Eightfold leverages artificial intelligence to transform how to think about skills and capabilities for individuals as well as how jobs and career decisions are made. Eightfold offers the industry’s first AI-powered Talent Intelligence Platform to transform how organisations plan, hire, develop and retain a diverse workforce, enabling individuals to transform their careers.
To date, Eightfold AI has received more than $410 million in funding and a valuation of over $2B from leading investors to further our mission of finding the right career for everyone in the world. If you are passionate about solving one of the most fundamental challenges of our society - employment, working on hard business problems, and being part of an amazing growth story - Eightfold is the place to be!

Eightfold.ai is led by Ashutosh Garg, a PhD in Machine Learning/IIT Delhi alumni who managed Search and Personalization at Google, and Varun Kacholia-IIT Bombay alumni, who led the News Feed Ranking team at Facebook and developed YouTube Search at Google.

About the Role
We are looking for an energetic and talented SOX IT Auditor with SOX compliance experience to join our growing and dynamic Internal Audit team. This position will report directly to the SOX IT Manager. This person will support the planning and execution of the SOX program with a primary focus on ITGCs, IT dependencies (e.g., automated controls and key reports), and impact assessments for projects related to financial system implementations. The candidate in this role will collaborate with the SOX program team and work cross-functionally with IT, process owners, and business owners to understand processes and risks, test the design and operating effectiveness of controls, and assess the reliability of system-generated information.
What You’ll Need
BA/BS degree in accounting, computer science, information systems, data analytics, finance, mathematics, or equivalent experience.
3+ years of auditing experience and relevant certifications, such as CIA, CPA, CISA and CFE. Preferred CISA or working towards designation.
Strong technical skills and working knowledge of COSO, ICFR, GAAP, ITGC domains (i.e., access management, change management, computer operations, program development), and globally recognized risk frameworks and auditing standards.
Demonstrated experience in all phases of the integrated audit, configuration of security and automated business process controls, and data interpretation for auditing.
Ability to quickly identify and communicate key risks and potential impacts.
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills including experience working on multi-national teams.
Experience drafting impactful and persuasive audit findings appropriate for both technical and not technical audiences.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, virtual environment.
Participate in operational audits walkthroughs and testing aimed to assess IT and business risks within the company.
