Role Description
As a Senior Database Developer you will design, develop, test, and implement effective and secure database solutions and models to store and retrieve company data to a high quality standard. You must be able to maintain existing systems whilst developing new solutions in line with the business requirements. You should be self-sufficient and be able to guide more junior developers at a technical level. You will work as part of a collaborative Agile development team, which will include Product Owners, a Scrum Master, Developers and UX/UX Design staff on the frontend, database and back-end elements of the 9ine App which is used by customers all over the world. You must have a can-do attitude and be willing to grow and adapt as the business grows its software service offering.
Responsibilities
You will be responsible for:
Collaboratively working within a team to develop solutions aligned with the business needs.
Taking business requirements and turning them into technical solutions.
Mentoring and training team members and ensuring they develop to quality standards.
Developing, implementing and maintaining solutions that are both reliable and scalable.
Recommending improvements to new and existing systems.
Ensuring compliance to code implementation procedures.
Documenting technical solutions in line with agreed quality standards.
Maintaining application performance.
Troubleshooting issues and carrying out root cause analysis.
Performing code and design reviews as per the code review process.
Optimising the integration and installation of new releases.
Migrating data from legacy systems to new solutions.
Providing regular updates.
Skills and Experience
6+ years of experience in database management and development.
Relevant qualifications in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.
Strong knowledge of data structures and database systems.
In depth expertise and hands on experience with Microsoft SQL Database Management System.
In depth expertise and hands on experience in database design, data maintenance, database security, data analysis and mining.
Hands-on experience with at least one web-hosting platform such as AWS (Amazon Web Services), Microsoft Azure, etc.
Strong understanding of security principles and how they apply to web applications.
Basic knowledge of networking.
Desirable knowledge of business intelligence (MSBI).
Desirable knowledge of data architectures related to data warehouse implementations.
Experience of working in Agile delivery model using Jira as the work management tool.
Fluency in both written and verbal English.
Strong interpersonal skills and a desire to work collaboratively to achieve objectives.
Understanding of Agile methodologies.
Excellent analytical skills.
Strong organisational skills.
Excellent problem-solving abilities.
Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills.
Value Add
Exposure to relevant subject matters, including: Enterprise Data Systems, AI, Machine Learning.
Experience of working effectively with global teams.
Professional Development Responsibilities
You will be required to:
Make recommendations about areas of improvement or development within the business.
Drive personal continued professional development in line with the business objectives.
Provide training and support to colleagues within the business and ensure their continuous development.
Identify new trends in technologies and structure training strategies for the team to help them adopt it.
Other Responsibilities
You will need to:
Undertake any other duties as reasonably required.
Work with other departments and colleagues to aid the successful completion of business priorities.
Work effectively as part of the 9ine team.
Showcase excellent organisational skills.
Think on your feet and use your initiative.
Maintain an enthusiastic and positive attitude.
Maintain strong interpersonal skills in order to build and develop relationships.
Have strong communication and presentation skills.
About 9ine
9ine is an EdTech consultancy supporting schools around the globe with technology related cyber security, data protection, safeguarding, risk and compliance solutions. Our head office is based in London with satellite offices in North America, and India which enable effective service provision to our expanding client portfolio across the UK, in Europe, Asia, Africa and North America. At the heart of our growth strategy lies the development of our 9ine App that is transforming how schools and SMEs manage their data privacy, cyber security and technology services.
Developed in-house, the 9ine App translates our 12+ years of experience in IT and privacy consultancy into a centralised GRC software platform. Our App automates risk and compliance processes for data privacy. Additional modules for safeguarding / child protection and cyber security and technology solutions management are due for launch in 2022. The App also has a range of additional value add services such as Project Management, Task Management and Incident Management.
Why 9ine?
9ine has big plans, by extending its reach to a wider client base around the globe it has a growth strategy to triple its employee headcount and turnover in the next three years.
To deliver our strategic plans we recognise the importance of both attracting and developing talent and as a result we are investing significantly at both a corporate and individual level to ensure we can deliver both the needs of today with the aspirations we have for tomorrow.
In becoming a true global player we understand that great people may not live and work where 9ine has its offices and are adopting blended working to ensure we can extend the opportunity to be part of something truly amazing wherever you are around the world.
In addition to our strong commercial plan we are evolving our ethical footprint. Our plans include reinvesting a percentage of our profits back into education oriented projects around the world.
With big plans comes big opportunity, if you are the kind of person that looking for a challenge, that wants to make an personal impact, that strives for high quality delivery in all you do, and values working for an organisation whose underlying principles are to support the protection of children in the education environment, then 9ine is the place for you.
Why Apply?
It's simple, why wouldn't you? Working for the world leader in its field, an ethical company who truly cares about its people and the people it serves, while being well rewarded for your contribution and developed from the moment you land…..
I know what you're thinking….. Where do I sign?

Position Overview:
This position is for a Geographic Information Systems (GIS) database administrator and developer to support integration of GIS tools with the digital delivery of GIS-specific deliverables for the customer. The GIS database administrator / developer deploys Bechtel project's GIS functionality and requires a firm understanding of the impacts and security implications of maintaining and operating an ArcGIS enterprise solution. This position requires an advanced level of proficiency and demonstrated experience in ArcGIS Servers, Enterprise GIS geodatabase, programming languages, and spatial analysis using ESRI-based products and open-source products. As the GIS database administrator / developer, the ideal candidate will be involved in geospatial web application development, geospatial analysis, development, and maintenance of GIS deliverables as well as linear project design and mapping and production of design deliverables for the customer.
Responsibilities:
Development of geospatial applications will also involve the integration of available resources and information from our customer's ArcGIS suite of tools.
Various ArcGIS Server and ArcGIS Portal Deployments and Configurations- Will aid in trouble shooting
Familiar with Oracle and SQL Server Databases Environments- Will aid in trouble shooting
Involved in web development languages and protocols such as JavaScript, HTML, AJAX, XML, SQL.
Use python with ESRI’s arcpy module to create script tools to batch process and speed up large-scale data conversions.
Experience using Geospatial applications involves incorporating web maps and web map services using ArcGIS Enterprise into a variety of web applications.

The ideal candidate must possess a strong background in GIS using ESRI ArcGIS Map's available tools including Analysis and Spatial Analyst.
Programming languages such as C/C++, Python, SQL, Java are required to perform basic programming tasks.
Experience using ArcGIS Pro is a plus.

applications.

About the Role
We are looking for an energetic and talented SOX IT Auditor with SOX compliance experience to join our growing and dynamic Internal Audit team. This position will report directly to the SOX IT Manager. This person will support the planning and execution of the SOX program with a primary focus on ITGCs, IT dependencies (e.g., automated controls and key reports), and impact assessments for projects related to financial system implementations. The candidate in this role will collaborate with the SOX program team and work cross-functionally with IT, process owners, and business owners to understand processes and risks, test the design and operating effectiveness of controls, and assess the reliability of system-generated information.
What You’ll Need
BA/BS degree in accounting, computer science, information systems, data analytics, finance, mathematics, or equivalent experience.
3+ years of auditing experience and relevant certifications, such as CIA, CPA, CISA and CFE. Preferred CISA or working towards designation.
Strong technical skills and working knowledge of COSO, ICFR, GAAP, ITGC domains (i.e., access management, change management, computer operations, program development), and globally recognized risk frameworks and auditing standards.
Demonstrated experience in all phases of the integrated audit, configuration of security and automated business process controls, and data interpretation for auditing.
Ability to quickly identify and communicate key risks and potential impacts.
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills including experience working on multi-national teams.
Experience drafting impactful and persuasive audit findings appropriate for both technical and not technical audiences.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, virtual environment.
Participate in operational audits walkthroughs and testing aimed to assess IT and business risks within the company.

Role Description
As a Senior Backend Developer you will design, develop, test, and implement effective and highly robust applications. You must be able to maintain existing systems whilst developing new solutions in line with the business requirements. You should be able to guide more junior developers at a technical level. You will work as part of a collaborative Agile development team, which will include Product Owners, a Scrum Master, Developers and UX/UX Design staff on the frontend, database and back-end elements of the 9ine App which is used by customers all over the world. You must have a can-do attitude and be willing to grow and adapt as the business grows its software service offering.
Responsibilities
You will be responsible for:
Collaboratively working within a team to develop solutions aligned with the business needs.
Taking business requirements and turning them into technical solutions.
Mentoring and training team members and ensuring they develop to quality standards.
Developing, implementing and maintaining solutions that are both reliable and scalable.
Recommending improvements to new and existing systems.
Ensuring compliance to code implementation procedures.
Documenting technical solutions in line with agreed quality standards.
Maintaining application performance.
Troubleshooting issues and carrying out root cause analysis.
Performing code and design reviews as per the code review process.
Providing regular updates.
Skills and Experience
6+ years experience using C#.net/MVC in .Net core or .Net framework using ADO.net, Web APIs and Microservices/N Layer Architecture.
Relevant qualifications in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.
Strong understanding of SOLID principles, design patterns and understanding of n Tier architecture.
Strong development experience in Azure environment, working with GIT versioning and branches, smooth code merge and integration operations.
Experience with leveraging Azure Services like Sendgrid, Azure Storage, WebJobs etc.
Experience in writing and maintaining secure, clean and efficient code, following coding standards and code review practices.
Experience of working in Agile delivery model using Jira as the work management tool.
Fluency in both written and verbal English.
Strong interpersonal skills and a desire to work collaboratively to achieve objectives.
Excellent analytical skills.
Strong organisational skills.
Excellent problem-solving abilities.
Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills.
Value Add
Knowledge of Javascript frameworks and libraries like Angular, React or Vue.
Experience using xUnit, nUnit or similar other tools for unit testing.
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure services, pipelines and DevOps.
Experience of working effectively with global teams.
Professional Development Responsibilities
You will be required to:
Make recommendations about areas of improvement or development within the business.
Drive personal continued professional development in line with the business objectives.
Provide training and support to colleagues within the business and ensure their continuous development.
Identify new trends in technologies and structure training strategies for the team to help them adopt it.
Other Responsibilities
You will need to:
Undertake any other duties as reasonably required.
Work with other departments and colleagues to aid the successful completion of business priorities.
Work effectively as part of the 9ine team.
Showcase excellent organisational skills.
Think on your feet and use your initiative.
Maintain an enthusiastic and positive attitude.
Maintain strong interpersonal skills in order to build and develop relationships.
Have strong communication and presentation skills.
About 9ine
9ine is an EdTech consultancy supporting schools around the globe with technology related cyber security, data protection, safeguarding, risk and compliance solutions. Our head office is based in London with satellite offices in North America, and India which enable effective service provision to our expanding client portfolio across the UK, in Europe, Asia, Africa and North America. At the heart of our growth strategy lies the development of our 9ine App that is transforming how schools and SMEs manage their data privacy, cyber security and technology services.
Developed in-house, the 9ine App translates our 12+ years of experience in IT and privacy consultancy into a centralised GRC software platform. Our App automates risk and compliance processes for data privacy. Additional modules for safeguarding / child protection and cyber security and technology solutions management are due for launch in 2022. The App also has a range of additional value add services such as Project Management, Task Management and Incident Management.
Why 9ine?
9ine has big plans, by extending its reach to a wider client base around the globe it has a growth strategy to triple its employee headcount and turnover in the next three years.
To deliver our strategic plans we recognise the importance of both attracting and developing talent and as a result we are investing significantly at both a corporate and individual level to ensure we can deliver both the needs of today with the aspirations we have for tomorrow.
In becoming a true global player we understand that great people may not live and work where 9ine has its offices and are adopting blended working to ensure we can extend the opportunity to be part of something truly amazing wherever you are around the world.
In addition to our strong commercial plan we are evolving our ethical footprint. Our plans include reinvesting a percentage of our profits back into education oriented projects around the world.
With big plans comes big opportunity, if you are the kind of person that looking for a challenge, that wants to make an personal impact, that strives for high quality delivery in all you do, and values working for an organisation whose underlying principles are to support the protection of children in the education environment, then 9ine is the place for you.
Why Apply?
It's simple, why wouldn't you? Working for the world leader in its field, an ethical company who truly cares about its people and the people it serves, while being well rewarded for your contribution and developed from the moment you land…..
I know what you're thinking….. Where do I sign?

About Eightfold:

Eightfold was founded with a vision to solve for employment in our society. For decades, the connection between individuals and opportunities has been based on who the individuals are and the strength of their network, vs. their potential. Eightfold leverages artificial intelligence to transform how to think about skills and capabilities for individuals as well as how jobs and career decisions are made. Eightfold offers the industry’s first AI-powered Talent Intelligence Platform to transform how organizations plan, hire, develop and retain a diverse workforce, enabling individuals to transform their careers.
We secured a $220M Series E funding round, led by SoftBank ’s Vision Fund in June 2021. Thus, we’ve raised more than $400 million in funding to date, including $350 million in the last six months. Job Summary

As a Senior Director of Software Engineering, in the most senior role in the function, you will utilize strong management and technical competencies to set objectives and develop strategies for the Cloud Volumes Services Engineering team. You will work with executive management and have the opportunity to directly impact the success of the function in meeting NetApp’s goals. You will provide direction and leadership to engineering managers and engineer team focused on development, testing and debugging of NetApp Cloud Volumes Services for GCP and Azure. These committed teams develop enhancements to existing products, as well as develop new products for cloud volumes services. As part of the Research and Development function, the overall focus of the group is on competitive market and customer requirements, technology advances, product quality, product cost and time-to-market.
Essential Functions:
Design, develop and implement strategies and plans that impact the long-term performance and competitiveness of the organization as a whole.
Influence policymaking.
Develop and approve exceptions to policy tied directly to area of responsibility.
Work collaboratively with other senior managers and vice presidents to establish strategic plans and objectives.
Participate in corporate development of methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for projects, programs and people within your area of responsibility.
Develop budgets for approval and assure adherence once budget is approved.
Utilize previous technical, project and people management experience to provide direction to senior managers and lead strategic global projects.
Job Requirements

Excellent oral and written communication skills are essential, especially presentation and negotiation skills.
A deep understanding of technology, how function relates to other functions and the business as a whole.
An in-depth understanding of concepts related to computer architecture, data structures and programming practices.
Experience in software development.
Prior experience with developing budgets and controlling costs.
A demonstrated ability to manage and lead manager level employees and complex projects.

Responsibility
This position is responsible for directing and controlling activities at the most senior level within the function and global geographic area.
The focus of this role is on translating functional strategies into operational plans and priorities. May develop functional strategies.
The potential impact of decisions made by this individual has significant operational or financial impact on the performance standards of the function and may impact the company’s success.
This individual will use in-depth knowledge to solve abstract issues and assess intangible variables, and establish long-range plans.
This individual is accountable for managing to assigned budget.

Interaction
This individual must demonstrate strong leadership skills by establishing clear goals, objectives and priorities that communicate the organization’s vision.
Works with senior management and vice president level employees addressing issues across companies and functions.
This position reports to a Vice President
Education & Experience

12+ years of experience as a people manager is required.
A Bachelor of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science, a Master Degree, or a PhD; or equivalent experience is required.
Extensive technical experience developing/delivering Cloud Services with hyperscaler platforms including Microsoft Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud Platform
Experience and understanding of modern cloud technologies and best development practices.
A proven track record with balancing multiple complex cross-functional projects and processes with multiple stakeholders

Job Description
The Sr.Manager, Infrastructure Services will oversee day-to-day operations as well as maintain a longer-term focus on helping grow the platform to the next level. Cloud Operations clients include various Inspire Brands teams, service partners, and development partners. As the Cloud Operations Sr.Manager you will lead a team that provides service insight, response, and service management to maintain high service reliability and availability with low touch through extensible services and platforms, standardized processes, data insights, and product feedback.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide guidance and assistance to Managers.
Oversee the administration of business-critical cloud-delivered systems and services.
Research and make decisions on software, processes, and partners to provide enterprise class support for Inspire Brands cloud platforms.
Ensure that comprehensive service and support procedures are implemented and well understood, and that service level objectives are met or exceeded as applicable.
Responsible for Platform and DevOps support related issues on a day-to-day basis, and long-term planning for maintaining technologically current, reliable, and cost-effective solutions.
Oversee and provide leadership direction during operational incidents, ensuring necessary resourcing and availability of subject matter expertise as well as proactive, business communications.
Ensure that requests and incidents are accurately documented, escalated, and resolved.
Responsible for continuously generating and analyzing metrics to ensure that performance levels are satisfactory, and trends are identified and proactively addressed as necessary.
Develop, implement, and manage governance models that enable business units to leverage cloud technology offerings securely and effectively.
Coordinate with functional or operational area Sr.Managers to understand their current and future information needs and develop plans, cost estimates, and schedules for integrating these needs into existing operations or develop plans for future operational support.
Ensure that technical and financial evaluation of services consider all specified requirements, and that product selection is based on thorough research.
Assist and advise in the areas of physical planning, security, backup and recovery and the logistics of contingency planning.
Develop processes to manage allocation, reporting and containment of costs for cloud platforms.
Maintain systems in accordance with best practices to improve security, reliability and resilience of the systems in production.
Recruit and retain top talent and coach and mentor team members.
Provide employee leadership, guidance, performance feedback and reviews, and individual/career development.
EDUCATION QUALIFICATION:
Required Minimum: BS/BA degree in IT or related field preferred; equivalent experience may be substituted in lieu of education.
EXPERIENCE QUALIFICATION:
6-8 years personnel management and leadership experience
12+ years of technical management/administration of operational technology systems
Hands-on technical expertise with implementation and administration of one or more cloud platforms is required. Azure is strongly preferred.

We are seeking a Quality Assurance Director to oversee our quality assurance program for our SaaS service company. The successful candidate will lead a team responsible for testing, assessing and validating software products to ensure they meet the company's standards for quality and reliability.

Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain quality assurance policies and procedures: The Quality Assurance Director will be responsible for establishing and maintaining the company's quality assurance policies and procedures. This includes identifying relevant quality standards and regulations, developing processes to ensure compliance, and implementing best practices.
Design and implement testing strategies: The Quality Assurance Director will lead the development and implementation of testing strategies for all software products. This includes defining testing methodologies, creating test plans and cases, executing tests, and analyzing results.
Manage and coach the QA team: The Quality Assurance Director will lead a team of QA professionals, providing guidance and support to ensure that team members are performing their duties effectively and efficiently. This includes coaching and mentoring team members, providing training and development opportunities, and evaluating performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams: The Quality Assurance Director will work closely with other teams, including product management, development, and customer support, to ensure that quality considerations are integrated into the product development process. This includes providing feedback and recommendations for product improvements and collaborating on issue resolution.
Develop metrics and reporting: The Quality Assurance Director will be responsible for tracking and reporting on the performance of the quality assurance program. This includes developing relevant metrics, analyzing data, and presenting findings to key stakeholders.
Continuous improvement: The Quality Assurance Director will be responsible for continuously improving the quality assurance program, including identifying areas for improvement, developing and implementing improvement initiatives, and monitoring progress.
Ensure compliance: The Quality Assurance Director will ensure that the company is complying with relevant quality standards and regulations. This includes identifying compliance requirements, developing processes to ensure compliance, and coordinating with internal and external auditors.
Risk management: The Quality Assurance Director will identify and manage risks related to product quality, including assessing the impact of defects and issues, prioritizing testing efforts, and collaborating with other teams to mitigate risks.

Required Skills and Qualifications :
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field.
10+ years of experience in software quality assurance, with at least 5 years of experience managing a team of QA professionals.
Experience with SaaS software development and deployment.
Strong knowledge of software testing methodologies, including manual and automated testing.
Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical issues to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proven experience in implementing quality assurance best practices and continuous improvement programs.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Overall, the Quality Assurance Director will play a critical role in ensuring the quality and reliability of the company's software products, as well as in driving continuous improvement and ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and standards.

We are a team of self-starters who excel in their fields. We believe in giving you responsibility, not a task. We want you to have ownership and pride in the work you are doing, and see the positive impact of your work on your colleagues, our customers, and the world. We believe in providing transparency and support, so you can do the best work of your career.

SailPoint is the Worldwide Leader for Enterprise-Class IAM (Identity and Access Management). We minimize risk and maximize business growth by managing access to data and resources across our client’s enterprise. We do it effectively and securely for every person who interacts with our client’s organization—any user, on any device, anywhere in the world.
We were first to recognize that companies could benefit from an approach to identity that addresses both IT and business priorities. We developed a unique, risk-based model and leveraged that approach for everything from compliance to user provisioning. Then we followed that with the industry's first solution for truly extending enterprise identity management to applications in the cloud.
Today, we offer comprehensive products that can handle enterprise IAM on-premises or as a cloud-based service. This gives you the freedom to choose the best solution for your current needs, while at the same time establishing a clear path for future growth.
The ideal candidate on the DevOps team will be a self-starter who enjoys a fast-paced job, thrives on problem solving, and is committed to delivering seamless product availability to large enterprises around the world.
Responsibilities:
Build and maintain a resilient, secure, and efficient SaaS application platform to meet established SLAs
Implement, maintain, and consult on the observability and monitoring framework that supports the needs of multiple internal stakeholders.
Collaborate with other teams on improving our observability systems
Interview and participate in building a team to establish a center of excellence and expertise in the Monitoring and Observability domains
Monitoring and incident response for distributed applications
Collaborate with developers to bring new features and services into production
Utilize a combination of open-source and custom software to solve product challenges
Serve as a mentor to junior engineers
Write and maintain architectural, stakeholder, and policy documentation
Proactively meet standards for information security and compliance, such as ISO, SOX, SSAE 16, etc.
Background & Experience:
Experience in 24x7 production operations, preferably supporting a highly available environment for a SaaS or cloud service provider
Experience with cloud infrastructure environments, preferably AWS
Extensive experience with logging, metrics and distributed tracing systems (e.g. Prometheus/Grafana/ElasticSearch/Honeycomb)
Experience working across departments evangelizing and communicating observability expertise and standards
Experience with containerization technology including: Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS ECS
Release automation (Jenkins, Argo, etc.), system administration, system configuration, and system debugging experience
Experience infrastructure-as-code tools (Terraform)
Strong understanding of system and networking concepts and troubleshooting techniques
Strong interpersonal and teaming skills - ability to set and enforce process and influence engineers who are not direct reports.
Ability to operate in an agile, entrepreneurial start-up environment.
Education:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or other technical discipline, or equivalent experience
5+ years of DevOps experience

2025! This is the year that Global Clinical supply is targeting for completing the evolution our systems into a “digital enabled” landscape of 300+ associates. Join a team of globally collaborative colleagues at the ‘Global Clinical Supply (GCS)’ function to support clinical trials from Phase 1 to approval and be a key interface between Technical Research & Development (TRD) teams and the Clinical teams! At GCS, we aspire to become a data and digital powered, resourceful , agile organization to deliver more products to more patients efficiently, through empowered and highly capable teams.

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Is responsible for generation/coordination of labels for IMP, medication list/randomization list/randomization schedules and ensures agreed milestones, quality and costs are met. Is accountable for label compliance with respect to study design, pack design, pack material, analytical specifications of the IMP along with country specific Regulatory Authority (RA) requirements and Novartis standards of compliance.
Maintains Phrase Library (validated repository of country specific HA regulatory requirement and translations of phrases in country specific languages), if nominated.
If nominated manages business administration activities of Labelling system and Randomization Re-porting Tool (RRT) and participate in system enhancement initiatives as appropriate. If required and qualified performs and documents GMP line unit checks of label(s) as defined in SOP. When required leads investigations if certified in case of quality events/deviations or any non-Right First Time (RFT) cases and notifies the Team Head or Deputy.
Keeps clear alignment with all the internal (e.g., Clinical Trial Supply Managers, Supply Chain Managers etc.) and external (e.g., external label service providers for specialized labels) stakeholders for IMP label related activities. Act as subject matter expert on label process during internal/external inspections as required.
Is responsible for communicating challenges to internal and external stakeholders and bring solutions to mitigate any risk(s). Support the Business owner by coordinating the vendor management and vendor performance when required. Manages all applicable finance activities, including grants, purchase orders (PO) and invoice approval for IMP labels, as applicable.
Is able to describe the fundamental process and answer question regarding label process during internal/external inspections. Support SME's / SPOC / SU / BPM (Business Process Manager) to define processes, identify and support initiatives for process improvement and simplification when required.
Actively participates in projects, networks and/or forums. Fulfill all related tasks and responsibilities related to own discipline. Be a mentor for the new CLM associates. Ensures colleagues know and use the appropriate processes and procedures and are aware of the risks of non-compliance as re-quired.
Ensures execution according to quality, quantity, and timelines of all assigned activities. Adheres to and utilizes existing processes and procedures to achieve agreed outcomes in a consistent and disciplined way. Completely adheres to Novartis values and behaviors.

Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:
Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.

3 years of practical experience in chemical / pharmaceutical industry or > 2years of experience in field of expertise

Basic knowledge of drug development and clinical supply process. Basic project management, good organization, and planning skills
Good knowledge of HSE/GMP standards and processes. Problem-solving and idea generation skills
Good presentation skills
Fundamental Leadership skills.
Good communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills. Ability to work in interdisciplinary teams

766 million lives were touched by Novartis medicines in 2021, and while we’re proud of this, we know there is so much more we could do to help improve and extend people’s lives.

Job Summary

This leading technical and architecture role will collaborate with product managers, architects, technology teams, analysts, marketing operations specialists, and monetization business partners to understand capabilities and that will be brought to life for Giant Eagle’s 4M+ customers. The ideal candidate will have experience within multiple technology platforms (e. g. GCP, Engagement Platforms, Customer Data Platform, Ad-Tech, etc.) while providing the vision and design for integrating customer data. Additional key skills and qualifications below
Job Description
Primary Job Responsibilities:
5+ years of relevant technical experience working with various data engineering methodologies such as data integration and data pipelines (ETL/ELT) to activate against data at scale.
3+ years of experience of data modeling for analytic projects activities that include design, curation, and management of large datasets
3+ years of experience adeveloping on big data technologies with Spark and Hive, preferably leveraging such as DataBricks, Juypter notebooks, or GCP, AWS, and Azure equivalent technology.
2+ years of experience data solution design for data engineering pipelines
Strong Experience building event driven systems using cloud technology: storage, Pub/Sub, cloud functions, API’s, and DataProc
Expertise with databases experience such as BigQuery, Snowflake, and Synapse designing schema and dimensional data modeling
Experience leveraging RESTful web services to collect and publish data.
Experience in software engineering development and testing life cycles using but not limited to Python, R, Linux, Java, JavaScript, Lambda, and SQL programming
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or other technical field or equivalent work experience. Advanced degree a plus
Experience with Retail Media Networks and Ad Tech preferred
Role Requirements:
Architect, develop and implement end-to-end complex data projects and technical solutions through translating business requirements into technical solutions and data-flow architectures.
Architect, build and automate data pipelines that clean, transform, and aggregate unorganized data into data sources that are ready for analysis.
Use expertise to apply various analytic methods to discover and interpret information about customer behavior from multiple data sources to implement analytics solutions
Use expertise in database design to implement, operate stable and scalable dataflows from multiple marketing platforms into a cloud data lake for Ad Tech
Experience building data visualization tools Tableau, PowerBI, and Looker with data modeling and Looker ML preferred
Design, implement and deploy data applications and mechanisms using big data technology
Provides subject matter expertise for multiple projects concurrently through all phases of the development lifecycle.
Develop, enhance, govern, and administer for data platform to: collect data, transform, enrich, unify, segment, and integrate data
Strong adherence data ethics rules around PII data sets
Work collaboratively with IT teams, Performance Marketing team, and business leaders to ensure actionable is provided key stakeholders
Research and analyze customer behavior data to improve customer experience
Experience with agile or other rapid application development methods a plus
Retail industry experience a plus
About the Company
Since our founding in 1931, Giant Eagle, Inc. has evolved into one of the top 40 largest private corporations in the U. S. and one of the country’s largest food retailers and distributors. With more than 37,000 Team Members and $9.7 billion in revenue, we are committed to investing in people, technology, and data to elevate our customer’s experience across multiple touchpoints. It helps us follow on our commitment to serving others and improving our communities.
About Giant Eagle Bangalore
The Giant Eagle GCC in Bangalore is our global capability center. Our team of more than 370 members at the GCC enables us to expand internal capabilities in the areas such as data analytics, merchandising and eCommerce, quality engineering, and automation to generate insights for faster decision-making and helping us accelerate our business strategy. Our team in India plays a pivotal role in helping the company transition to new ways of working by redefining the food and grocery shopping experience for over 4.6 million customers.
About Us
At Giant Eagle Inc., we’re more than just food, fuel and convenience. We’re one giant family of diverse and talented Team Members. Our people are the heart and soul of our company. It’s why we strive to create a nurturing environment that offers countless career opportunities to grow. Deep caring and solid family values are what makes us one of the top work places for jobs in the Greater Pittsburgh, Cleveland, Columbus and Indianapolis Areas. From our Warehouses to our GetGo’s, our grocery Stores through our Corporate home office, we are working together to put food on shoppers' tables and smiles on their faces. We’re always searching for the best Team Members to welcome to our family. We invite you to join our Giant Eagle family. Come start a lasting career with us.

POSITION TITLE
Quality Assurance Analyst

LOCATION
Remote India
HOURS
2:00 pm to 11:00 pm IST

YOUR ROLE
The quality of Investment’s data, processes and software is critically important to achieve business results. The Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst will work directly with project and business teams to ensure the highest quality execution. This role also provides a prime opportunity to learn about all aspects of Investments.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
Plan, document and execute test cases using business requirements or in some cases undefined/loosely defined requirements as needed. Experience using a Test Management solution such as PractiTest, ALM or equivalent. Prioritize and sequence test case execution according to defined test strategy and milestones. Provide input to timeline estimations.
Analyze unexpected results, working with IT to identify root cause and potential solutions. Document, monitor and communicate defects as well as the status of project tasks within JIRA.
Work closely and proactively communicate with the entire project team as needed to effectively complete testing activities. Understand your testing responsibilities, as well how it fits into the overall testing responsibilities of others, as specified by the team Test Strategy.
Utilize standardized tools to perform validation comparisons, including Excel and advanced Excel macros, provided SQL scripts, DVT & Spreadsheet compare.

Role Description
As a Senior Database Developer you will design, develop, test, and implement effective and secure database solutions and models to store and retrieve company data to a high quality standard. You must be able to maintain existing systems whilst developing new solutions in line with the business requirements. You should be self-sufficient and be able to guide more junior developers at a technical level. You will work as part of a collaborative Agile development team, which will include Product Owners, a Scrum Master, Developers and UX/UX Design staff on the frontend, database and back-end elements of the 9ine App which is used by customers all over the world. You must have a can-do attitude and be willing to grow and adapt as the business grows its software service offering.
Responsibilities
You will be responsible for:
Collaboratively working within a team to develop solutions aligned with the business needs.
Taking business requirements and turning them into technical solutions.
Mentoring and training team members and ensuring they develop to quality standards.
Developing, implementing and maintaining solutions that are both reliable and scalable.
Recommending improvements to new and existing systems.
Ensuring compliance to code implementation procedures.
Documenting technical solutions in line with agreed quality standards.
Maintaining application performance.
Troubleshooting issues and carrying out root cause analysis.
Performing code and design reviews as per the code review process.
Optimising the integration and installation of new releases.
Migrating data from legacy systems to new solutions.
Providing regular updates.

6+ years of experience in database management and development.
Relevant qualifications in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.
Strong knowledge of data structures and database systems.
In depth expertise and hands on experience with Microsoft SQL Database Management System.
In depth expertise and hands on experience in database design, data maintenance, database security, data analysis and mining.
Hands-on experience with at least one web-hosting platform such as AWS (Amazon Web Services), Microsoft Azure, etc.
Strong understanding of security principles and how they apply to web applications.
Basic knowledge of networking.
Desirable knowledge of business intelligence (MSBI).
Desirable knowledge of data architectures related to data warehouse implementations.
Experience of working in Agile delivery model using Jira as the work management tool.
Fluency in both written and verbal English.
Strong interpersonal skills and a desire to work collaboratively to achieve objectives.
Understanding of Agile methodologies.
Excellent analytical skills.
Strong organisational skills.
Excellent problem-solving abilities.
Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills.

Experience of working effectively with global teams.

About 9ine
9ine is an EdTech consultancy supporting schools around the globe with technology related cyber security, data protection, safeguarding, risk and compliance solutions. Our head office is based in London with satellite offices in North America, and India which enable effective service provision to our expanding client portfolio across the UK, in Europe, Asia, Africa and North America. At the heart of our growth strategy lies the development of our 9ine App that is transforming how schools and SMEs manage their data privacy, cyber security and technology services.
Developed in-house, the 9ine App translates our 12+ years of experience in IT and privacy consultancy into a centralised GRC software platform. Our App automates risk and compliance processes for data privacy. Additional modules for safeguarding / child protection and cyber security and technology solutions management are due for launch in 2022. The App also has a range of additional value add services such as Project Management, Task Management and Incident Management.
Why 9ine?
9ine has big plans, by extending its reach to a wider client base around the globe it has a growth strategy to triple its employee headcount and turnover in the next three years.
To deliver our strategic plans we recognise the importance of both attracting and developing talent and as a result we are investing significantly at both a corporate and individual level to ensure we can deliver both the needs of today with the aspirations we have for tomorrow.
In becoming a true global player we understand that great people may not live and work where 9ine has its offices and are adopting blended working to ensure we can extend the opportunity to be part of something truly amazing wherever you are around the world.
In addition to our strong commercial plan we are evolving our ethical footprint. Our plans include reinvesting a percentage of our profits back into education oriented projects around the world.
With big plans comes big opportunity, if you are the kind of person that looking for a challenge, that wants to make an personal impact, that strives for high quality delivery in all you do, and values working for an organisation whose underlying principles are to support the protection of children in the education environment, then 9ine is the place for you.
Why Apply?
It's simple, why wouldn't you? Working for the world leader in its field, an ethical company who truly cares about its people and the people it serves, while being well rewarded for your contribution and developed from the moment you land…..
I know what you're thinking….. Where do I sign?

Position Overview:
This position is for a Geographic Information Systems (GIS) database administrator and developer to support integration of GIS tools with the digital delivery of GIS-specific deliverables for the customer. The GIS database administrator / developer deploys Bechtel project's GIS functionality and requires a firm understanding of the impacts and security implications of maintaining and operating an ArcGIS enterprise solution. This position requires an advanced level of proficiency and demonstrated experience in ArcGIS Servers, Enterprise GIS geodatabase, programming languages, and spatial analysis using ESRI-based products and open-source products. As the GIS database administrator / developer, the ideal candidate will be involved in geospatial web application development, geospatial analysis, development, and maintenance of GIS deliverables as well as linear project design and mapping and production of design deliverables for the customer.
Responsibilities:
Development of geospatial applications will also involve the integration of available resources and information from our customer's ArcGIS suite of tools.
Various ArcGIS Server and ArcGIS Portal Deployments and Configurations- Will aid in trouble shooting
Familiar with Oracle and SQL Server Databases Environments- Will aid in trouble shooting
Involved in web development languages and protocols such as JavaScript, HTML, AJAX, XML, SQL.
Use python with ESRI’s arcpy module to create script tools to batch process and speed up large-scale data conversions.
Experience using Geospatial applications involves incorporating web maps and web map services using ArcGIS Enterprise into a variety of web applications.
Produce applications including ArcGIS Field Maps, Survey 123, dashboards, and other popular applications that can include a variety of media and data formats to present information on a specific topic.
The ideal candidate must possess a strong background in GIS using ESRI ArcGIS Map's available tools including Analysis and Spatial Analyst.
Programming languages such as C/C++, Python, SQL, Java are required to perform basic programming tasks.
Experience using ArcGIS Pro is a plus.

applications.
Engages in various project processes involving metadata, spatial analysis, GPS information gathering, data conversions,
Geoprocessing, etc.
Consults, as an SME, by clearly and effectively communicate technical information to non-technical and technical users.

Work with the GIS team and Bechtel's clients to ensure data quality and completeness.

About NetApp
We’re forward-thinking technology people with heart. We make our own rules, drive our own opportunities, and try to approach every challenge with fresh eyes. Of course, we can’t do it alone. "At NetApp, we fully embrace and advance a diverse, inclusive global workforce with a culture of belonging that leverages the backgrounds and perspectives of all employees, customers, partners, and communities to foster a higher performing organization." -George Kurian, CEO

Senior Identity & Access Management Engineer

As an IAM Systems Engineer you are part of a team that is responsible for design, analysis, evaluation, testing, debugging and implementation of Identity and Access Management applications programs in support of NetApp’s various functional areas. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to understand and address customer need and develop implementation plans.

Essential Functions:
The Identity & Access Management group is part of NetApp’s Global Security (GS) function and is responsible for a wide range of applications technical expertise and security. This team is accountable for the core Identity and Access Management Infrastructure at NetApp. As a part of a team, you will help to ensure that team objectives and project deadlines are met. The essential functions of the team include:
Create long-term strategy for the department and communicate it to team members and peers in other functional areas.
Plan, design, implement, and lead application installation projects or operating process.
Analyze, test, and debug applications.
Develop IAM interfacing with corporate driven applications across functional areas such as Marketing, Finance, Manufacturing, etc.
Develop and maintain systems level software and utilities for both existing and new systems. Develop and Support Web Service interfaces to and from IAM systems.
Plan, conduct and direct the analysis of business problems to be solved with automated systems. May work with technical teams, including Business Systems Analysts, to understand functional business needs and jointly develop automated solutions.
Write, maintain, and implement systems specifications and corresponding maintenance documentation.
Help with problem diagnosis and resolution.
Ensure client satisfaction for delivered technical solutions.
Reporting to customers and management on status, resources need, and projected outcomes.
Mentorship and training of IAM Engineers and developers by more senior members of the team on processes and tools.
Project management.

We are seeking a Quality Assurance Director to oversee our quality assurance program for our SaaS service company. The successful candidate will lead a team responsible for testing, assessing and validating software products to ensure they meet the company's standards for quality and reliability.

Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain quality assurance policies and procedures: The Quality Assurance Director will be responsible for establishing and maintaining the company's quality assurance policies and procedures. This includes identifying relevant quality standards and regulations, developing processes to ensure compliance, and implementing best practices.
Design and implement testing strategies: The Quality Assurance Director will lead the development and implementation of testing strategies for all software products. This includes defining testing methodologies, creating test plans and cases, executing tests, and analyzing results.
Manage and coach the QA team: The Quality Assurance Director will lead a team of QA professionals, providing guidance and support to ensure that team members are performing their duties effectively and efficiently. This includes coaching and mentoring team members, providing training and development opportunities, and evaluating performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams: The Quality Assurance Director will work closely with other teams, including product management, development, and customer support, to ensure that quality considerations are integrated into the product development process. This includes providing feedback and recommendations for product improvements and collaborating on issue resolution.
Develop metrics and reporting: The Quality Assurance Director will be responsible for tracking and reporting on the performance of the quality assurance program. This includes developing relevant metrics, analyzing data, and presenting findings to key stakeholders.
Continuous improvement: The Quality Assurance Director will be responsible for continuously improving the quality assurance program, including identifying areas for improvement, developing and implementing improvement initiatives, and monitoring progress.
Ensure compliance: The Quality Assurance Director will ensure that the company is complying with relevant quality standards and regulations. This includes identifying compliance requirements, developing processes to ensure compliance, and coordinating with internal and external auditors.
Risk management: The Quality Assurance Director will identify and manage risks related to product quality, including assessing the impact of defects and issues, prioritizing testing efforts, and collaborating with other teams to mitigate risks.

Required Skills and Qualifications :
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field.
10+ years of experience in software quality assurance, with at least 5 years of experience managing a team of QA professionals.
Experience with SaaS software development and deployment.
Strong knowledge of software testing methodologies, including manual and automated testing.
Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical issues to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proven experience in implementing quality assurance best practices and continuous improvement programs.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Overall, the Quality Assurance Director will play a critical role in ensuring the quality and reliability of the company's software products, as well as in driving continuous improvement and ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and standards.

We are a team of self-starters who excel in their fields. We believe in giving you responsibility, not a task. We want you to have ownership and pride in the work you are doing, and see the positive impact of your work on your colleagues, our customers, and the world. Role Description
As a Senior Backend Developer you will design, develop, test, and implement effective and highly robust applications. You must be able to maintain existing systems whilst developing new solutions in line with the business requirements. You should be able to guide more junior developers at a technical level. You will work as part of a collaborative Agile development team, which will include Product Owners, a Scrum Master, Developers and UX/UX Design staff on the frontend, database and back-end elements of the 9ine App which is used by customers all over the world. You must have a can-do attitude and be willing to grow and adapt as the business grows its software service offering.
Responsibilities
You will be responsible for:
Collaboratively working within a team to develop solutions aligned with the business needs.
Taking business requirements and turning them into technical solutions.
Mentoring and training team members and ensuring they develop to quality standards.
Developing, implementing and maintaining solutions that are both reliable and scalable.
Recommending improvements to new and existing systems.
Ensuring compliance to code implementation procedures.
Documenting technical solutions in line with agreed quality standards.
Maintaining application performance.
Troubleshooting issues and carrying out root cause analysis.
Performing code and design reviews as per the code review process.
Providing regular updates.
Skills and Experience
6+ years experience using C#.net/MVC in .Net core or .Net framework using ADO.net, Web APIs and Microservices/N Layer Architecture.
Relevant qualifications in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.
Strong understanding of SOLID principles, design patterns and understanding of n Tier architecture.
Strong development experience in Azure environment, working with GIT versioning and branches, smooth code merge and integration operations.
Experience with leveraging Azure Services like Sendgrid, Azure Storage, WebJobs etc.
Experience in writing and maintaining secure, clean and efficient code, following coding standards and code review practices.
Experience of working in Agile delivery model using Jira as the work management tool.
Fluency in both written and verbal English.
Strong interpersonal skills and a desire to work collaboratively to achieve objectives.
Excellent analytical skills.
Strong organisational skills.
Excellent problem-solving abilities.
Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills.
Value Add
Knowledge of Javascript frameworks and libraries like Angular, React or Vue.
Experience using xUnit, nUnit or similar other tools for unit testing.
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure services, pipelines and DevOps.
Experience of working effectively with global teams.
Professional Development Responsibilities
You will be required to:
Make recommendations about areas of improvement or development within the business.
Drive personal continued professional development in line with the business objectives.
Provide training and support to colleagues within the business and ensure their continuous development.
Identify new trends in technologies and structure training strategies for the team to help them adopt it.
Other Responsibilities
You will need to:
Undertake any other duties as reasonably required.
Work with other departments and colleagues to aid the successful completion of business priorities.
Work effectively as part of the 9ine team.
Showcase excellent organisational skills.
Think on your feet and use your initiative.
Maintain an enthusiastic and positive attitude.
Maintain strong interpersonal skills in order to build and develop relationships.
Have strong communication and presentation skills.
About 9ine
9ine is an EdTech consultancy supporting schools around the globe with technology related cyber security, data protection, safeguarding, risk and compliance solutions. Our head office is based in London with satellite offices in North America, and India which enable effective service provision to our expanding client portfolio across the UK, in Europe, Asia, Africa and North America. At the heart of our growth strategy lies the development of our 9ine App that is transforming how schools and SMEs manage their data privacy, cyber security and technology services.
Developed in-house, the 9ine App translates our 12+ years of experience in IT and privacy consultancy into a centralised GRC software platform. Our App automates risk and compliance processes for data privacy. Additional modules for safeguarding / child protection and cyber security and technology solutions management are due for launch in 2022. The App also has a range of additional value add services such as Project Management, Task Management and Incident Management.
Why 9ine?
9ine has big plans, by extending its reach to a wider client base around the globe it has a growth strategy to triple its employee headcount and turnover in the next three years.
To deliver our strategic plans we recognise the importance of both attracting and developing talent and as a result we are investing significantly at both a corporate and individual level to ensure we can deliver both the needs of today with the aspirations we have for tomorrow.
In becoming a true global player we understand that great people may not live and work where 9ine has its offices and are adopting blended working to ensure we can extend the opportunity to be part of something truly amazing wherever you are around the world.
In addition to our strong commercial plan we are evolving our ethical footprint. Our plans include reinvesting a percentage of our profits back into education oriented projects around the world.
With big plans comes big opportunity, if you are the kind of person that looking for a challenge, that wants to make an personal impact, that strives for high quality delivery in all you do, and values working for an organisation whose underlying principles are to support the protection of children in the education environment, then 9ine is the place for you.
Why Apply?
It's simple, why wouldn't you? Working for the world leader in its field, an ethical company who truly cares about its people and the people it serves, while being well rewarded for your contribution and developed from the moment you land…..
I know what you're thinking….. Where do I sign?

These committed teams develop enhancements to existing products, as well as develop new products for cloud volumes services. As part of the Research and Development function, the overall focus of the group is on competitive market and customer requirements, technology advances, product quality, product cost and time-to-market.

Job Description
The Sr.Manager, Infrastructure Services will oversee day-to-day operations as well as maintain a longer-term focus on helping grow the platform to the next level. Cloud Operations clients include various Inspire Brands teams, service partners, and development partners. As the Cloud Operations Sr.Manager you will lead a team that provides service insight, response, and service management to maintain high service reliability and availability with low touch through extensible services and platforms, standardized processes, data insights, and product feedback.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide guidance and assistance to Managers.
Oversee the administration of business-critical cloud-delivered systems and services.
Research and make decisions on software, processes, and partners to provide enterprise class support for Inspire Brands cloud platforms.
Ensure that comprehensive service and support procedures are implemented and well understood, and that service level objectives are met or exceeded as applicable.
Responsible for Platform and DevOps support related issues on a day-to-day basis, and long-term planning for maintaining technologically current, reliable, and cost-effective solutions.
Oversee and provide leadership direction during operational incidents, ensuring necessary resourcing and availability of subject matter expertise as well as proactive, business communications.
Ensure that requests and incidents are accurately documented, escalated, and resolved.
Responsible for continuously generating and analyzing metrics to ensure that performance levels are satisfactory, and trends are identified and proactively addressed as necessary.
Develop, implement, and manage governance models that enable business units to leverage cloud technology offerings securely and effectively.
Coordinate with functional or operational area Sr.Managers to understand their current and future information needs and develop plans, cost estimates, and schedules for integrating these needs into existing operations or develop plans for future operational support.

SailPoint is the Worldwide Leader for Enterprise-Class IAM (Identity and Access Management). We minimize risk and maximize business growth by managing access to data and resources across our client’s enterprise. We do it effectively and securely for every person who interacts with our client’s organization—any user, on any device, anywhere in the world.
We were first to recognize that companies could benefit from an approach to identity that addresses both IT and business priorities. We developed a unique, risk-based model and leveraged that approach for everything from compliance to user provisioning. Then we followed that with the industry's first solution for truly extending enterprise identity management to applications in the cloud.
Today, we offer comprehensive products that can handle enterprise IAM on-premises or as a cloud-based service. This gives you the freedom to choose the best solution for your current needs, while at the same time establishing a clear path for future growth.
The ideal candidate on the DevOps team will be a self-starter who enjoys a fast-paced job, thrives on problem solving, and is committed to delivering seamless product availability to large enterprises around the world.
Responsibilities:
Build and maintain a resilient, secure, and efficient SaaS application platform to meet established SLAs
Implement, maintain, and consult on the observability and monitoring framework that supports the needs of multiple internal stakeholders.
Collaborate with other teams on improving our observability systems
Interview and participate in building a team to establish a center of excellence and expertise in the Monitoring and Observability domains
Monitoring and incident response for distributed applications
Collaborate with developers to bring new features and services into production
Utilize a combination of open-source and custom software to solve product challenges
Serve as a mentor to junior engineers
Write and maintain architectural, stakeholder, and policy documentation
Proactively meet standards for information security and compliance, such as ISO, SOX, SSAE 16, etc.
Background & Experience:
Experience in 24x7 production operations, preferably supporting a highly available environment for a SaaS or cloud service provider
Experience with cloud infrastructure environments, preferably AWS
Extensive experience with logging, metrics and distributed tracing systems (e.g. Prometheus/Grafana/ElasticSearch/Honeycomb)
Experience working across departments evangelizing and communicating observability expertise and standards
Experience with containerization technology including: Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS ECS
Release automation (Jenkins, Argo, etc.), system administration, system configuration, and system debugging experience
Experience infrastructure-as-code tools (Terraform)
Strong understanding of system and networking concepts and troubleshooting techniques
Strong interpersonal and teaming skills - ability to set and enforce process and influence engineers who are not direct reports.
Ability to operate in an agile, entrepreneurial start-up environment.
Education:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or other technical discipline, or equivalent experience
5+ years of DevOps experience
SailPoint is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome everyone to our team. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Architect, develop and implement end-to-end complex data projects and technical solutions through translating business requirements into technical solutions and data-flow architectures.

Use expertise to apply various analytic methods to discover and interpret information about customer behavior from multiple data sources to implement analytics solutions
Use expertise in database design to implement, operate stable and scalable dataflows from multiple marketing platforms into a cloud data lake for Ad Tech
Experience building data visualization tools Tableau, PowerBI, and Looker with data modeling and Looker ML preferred

About the Company
Since our founding in 1931, Giant Eagle, Inc. has evolved into one of the top 40 largest private corporations in the U. S. and one of the country’s largest food retailers and distributors. With more than 37,000 Team Members and $9.7 billion in revenue, we are committed to investing in people, technology, and data to elevate our customer’s experience across multiple touchpoints. It helps us follow on our commitment to serving others and improving our communities.
About Giant Eagle Bangalore
The Giant Eagle GCC in Bangalore is our global capability center. Our team of more than 370 members at the GCC enables us to expand internal capabilities in the areas such as data analytics, merchandising and eCommerce, quality engineering, and automation to generate insights for faster decision-making and helping us accelerate our business strategy. Our team in India plays a pivotal role in helping the company transition to new ways of working by redefining the food and grocery shopping experience for over 4.6 million customers.
About Us
At Giant Eagle Inc., we’re more than just food, fuel and convenience. We’re one giant family of diverse and talented Team Members. Our people are the heart and soul of our company. It’s why we strive to create a nurturing environment that offers countless career opportunities to grow. Deep caring and solid family values are what makes us one of the top work places for jobs in the Greater Pittsburgh, Cleveland, Columbus and Indianapolis Areas. From our Warehouses to our GetGo’s, our grocery Stores through our Corporate home office, we are working together to put food on shoppers' tables and smiles on their faces. We’re always searching for the best Team Members to welcome to our family. We invite you to join our Giant Eagle family. Come start a lasting career with us.

Role Description
As a Senior Database Developer you will design, develop, test, and implement effective and secure database solutions and models to store and retrieve company data to a high quality standard. You must be able to maintain existing systems whilst developing new solutions in line with the business requirements. You should be self-sufficient and be able to guide more junior developers at a technical level. You will work as part of a collaborative Agile development team, which will include Product Owners, a Scrum Master, Developers and UX/UX Design staff on the frontend, database and back-end elements of the 9ine App which is used by customers all over the world. You must have a can-do attitude and be willing to grow and adapt as the business grows its software service offering.
Responsibilities
You will be responsible for:
Collaboratively working within a team to develop solutions aligned with the business needs.
Taking business requirements and turning them into technical solutions.
Mentoring and training team members and ensuring they develop to quality standards.
Developing, implementing and maintaining solutions that are both reliable and scalable.
Recommending improvements to new and existing systems.
Ensuring compliance to code implementation procedures.
Documenting technical solutions in line with agreed quality standards.
Maintaining application performance.
Troubleshooting issues and carrying out root cause analysis.
Performing code and design reviews as per the code review process.

Providing regular updates.
Skills and Experience
6+ years of experience in database management and development.
Relevant qualifications in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.
Strong knowledge of data structures and database systems.

About 9ine
9ine is an EdTech consultancy supporting schools around the globe with technology related cyber security, data protection, safeguarding, risk and compliance solutions. Our head office is based in London with satellite offices in North America, and India which enable effective service provision to our expanding client portfolio across the UK, in Europe, Asia, Africa and North America. At the heart of our growth strategy lies the development of our 9ine App that is transforming how schools and SMEs manage their data privacy, cyber security and technology services.
Developed in-house, the 9ine App translates our 12+ years of experience in IT and privacy consultancy into a centralised GRC software platform. Our App automates risk and compliance processes for data privacy. Additional modules for safeguarding / child protection and cyber security and technology solutions management are due for launch in 2022. The App also has a range of additional value add services such as Project Management, Task Management and Incident Management.
Why 9ine?
9ine has big plans, by extending its reach to a wider client base around the globe it has a growth strategy to triple its employee headcount and turnover in the next three years.
To deliver our strategic plans we recognise the importance of both attracting and developing talent and as a result we are investing significantly at both a corporate and individual level to ensure we can deliver both the needs of today with the aspirations we have for tomorrow.
In becoming a true global player we understand that great people may not live and work where 9ine has its offices and are adopting blended working to ensure we can extend the opportunity to be part of something truly amazing wherever you are around the world.
In addition to our strong commercial plan we are evolving our ethical footprint. Our plans include reinvesting a percentage of our profits back into education oriented projects around the world.
With big plans comes big opportunity, if you are the kind of person that looking for a challenge, that wants to make an personal impact, that strives for high quality delivery in all you do, and values working for an organisation whose underlying principles are to support the protection of children in the education environment, then 9ine is the place for you.
Why Apply?
It's simple, why wouldn't you? Working for the world leader in its field, an ethical company who truly cares about its people and the people it serves, while being well rewarded for your contribution and developed from the moment you land…..
I know what you're thinking….. Where do I sign?
